frequentamentum: <entryFree id="n18756" type="main" key="fre^quenta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĕquentāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>frequento</etym>, <sense id="n18756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a repetition</hi> in speaking (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:1:1" default="NO">5, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
frequentarium: <entryFree id="n18757" type="gloss" key="fre^quenta_rium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĕquentārium</orth> <itype>frequentem</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=93" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 93</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
frequentatio: <entryFree id="n18758" type="main" key="fre^quenta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĕquentātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>frequento</etym>, <sense id="n18758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">frequency</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frequent use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a crowding together.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18758.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">matrimoniorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:6:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 6, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18758.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in rhet. lang. (esp. in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">densa et continens verborum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 19, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentorum et coacervatio universa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 35, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consequentium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18758.3" n="B" level="2"> As a flg. of speech, <hi rend="ital">a condensed recapitulation of the arguments already stated separately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a recapitulation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summing up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequentatio est, cum res in tota causa dispersae coguntur in unum, quo gravior aut criminosior oratio sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 40, 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frequentative: <entryFree id="n18759" type="main" key="fre^quenta_ti_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĕquentātīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. frequentativus <sense id="n18759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
frequentativus: <entryFree id="n18760" type="main" key="fre^quenta_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĕquentātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>frequento</etym>, in the later gramm., <sense id="n18760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that denotes the repetition of an act</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frequentative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:6:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 336</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum qualitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 335</bibl></cit> P.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">frĕquentātīve</orth>, <hi rend="ital">frequentatively</hi>, Fest. s. v. verberitare, p. 379 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
frequentator: <entryFree id="n18761" type="main" key="fre^quenta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĕquentātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (postclass.), <sense id="n18761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a frequent visitor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a frequenter</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">prandiorum et cenarum cum publicanis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Monog. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (but in <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trism. 94, 23</bibl>, the better read. is gubernator; v. Hildebr. ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
frequentatus: <entryFree id="n18762" type="main" key="fre^quenta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĕquentātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from frequento.</entryFree>
frequenter: <entryFree id="n18763" type="main" key="fre^quenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĕquenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. frequens <sense id="n18763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
frequentia: <entryFree id="n18764" type="main" key="fre^quenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĕquentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>frequens, II.</etym>, <sense id="n18764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an</hi> <cb n="FREQ" /> <hi rend="ital">assembling in great numbers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a numerous attendance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concourse;</hi> and more freq. concr., <hi rend="ital">a numerous assembly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">multitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crowd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throng</hi> (class.; a favorite expression of Cicero). </sense><sense id="n18764.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testis est hujusce Q. Mucii janua et vestibulum, quod maxima cottidie frequentia civium ac summorum hominum splendore celebratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotidiana amicorum assiduitas et frequentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:77:section=189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 77, § 189</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 23, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotiatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 47, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auditorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scholarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistolarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna sepulcrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">geniculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 91, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the density of the air</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thucydides ita creber est rerum frequentiā, ut verborum prope numerum sententiarum numero consequatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 13, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:12:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 12, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18764.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum reduci e campo cum maxima frequentia ac multitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequentia et plausus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non usitata frequentia stipati sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">efferri magna frequentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solidam et robustam et assiduam frequentiam praebere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequentiam atque officium suum alicui praestare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:50:3" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 50, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua ex frequentia (preceded by magna multitudo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 19, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frequento: <entryFree id="n18765" type="main" key="fre^quento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĕquento</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>frequens</etym>. <sense id="n18765.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to frequens, I.) <hi rend="ital">To visit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">resort to frequently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to frequent; to do</hi> or <hi rend="ital">make use of frequently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to repeat</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sermones eorum, qui frequentant domum meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventus, quae domum Catilinae frequentabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Vespasianus) locum incunabulorum assidue frequentavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scholam alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum deus Eurotan immunitamque frequentat Sparten,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebes sic accensa, uti opifices agrestesque omnes relictis operibus frequentarent Marium,</quote> <trans><tr>often visited</tr>, <tr>resorted to him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 73:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 73, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis jam juventutis concursu, jam publicis studiis frequentabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 10</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istoc quidem nos pretio facile est frequentare tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne coetu salutantium frequentaretur Agrippina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si aliquando alio domino solita est frequentari (domus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:139" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 39, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae loca et nationes minus frequentata sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu primas quasque partes in animo frequenta,</quote> <trans><tr>frequently think over</tr>, <tr>repeat</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 24, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec frequentat Phalereus maxime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:27:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 27, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">25, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba ruunt et Hymen clamant, Hymenaee frequentant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam alicujus,</quote> <trans><tr>to call to mind often</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 3:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exigis ut hoc epistolarum commercium frequentemus,</quote> <trans><tr>exchange letters oftener</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 38:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 38, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ideo conjugia et educationes liberum frequentabantur praevalida orbitate,</quote> <trans><tr>became more frequent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima trullis frequentetur inductio (calcis),</quote> <trans><tr>be repeated</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbi translatio instituta est inopiae causa, frequentata delectationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:38:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 38, 155</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (exempla levitatis Atheniensium) nata et frequentata apud illos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n18765.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to frequens, II.) <hi rend="ital">To fill with a great number</hi> or <hi rend="ital">multitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crowd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stock</hi> a place; <hi rend="ital">to assemble</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring together in numbers</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n18765.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes sine hominum coetu non potuissent nec aedificari nec frequentari,</quote> <trans><tr>be peopled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:4:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiae solitudinem frequentari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 19, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa frequentari nunc decet,</quote> <trans><tr>to be crowded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:871" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 871</bibl></cit>: mundum nova prole, <hi rend="ital">to stock</hi>, Col. poët. 10, 213: <cit><quote lang="la">piscinas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castaneta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos cum casu hic dies ad aerarium frequentasset, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>had assembled in great numbers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:33:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 33, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acervatim multa frequentans,</quote> <trans><tr>crowding together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:25:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 25, 85</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tum est quasi luminibus distinguenda et frequentanda omnis oratio sententiarum atque verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:52:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 52, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digressis qui Pacarium frequentabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 16</bibl></cit>; v. frequentatio, II.—</sense><sense id="n18765.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (like celebro, but much less freq.), <hi rend="ital">to celebrate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">keep in great numbers</hi>, esp. a festival: publicum est, quod civitas universa <cb n="FRET" /> aliqua de causa frequentat, ut ludi, dies festus, bellum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:27:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 27, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ad triumphum frequentandum deductos esse milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mors Sulpicii publicis exsequiis frequentaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18765.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> and post-Aug. also of a single person, <hi rend="ital">to celebrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Baccheaque sacra frequento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:691" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 691</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">festos dies apud Baias Nero frequentabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 4</bibl></cit> Draeg. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">dies sollennes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorundam exsequias usque ad rogum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cererem (Ennaeae nurus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 77</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">frĕquen-tātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n18765.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Frequent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">much used</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 61, § 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma reginis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 145</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n18765.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Full of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rich</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abounding in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud genus est non tam sententiis frequentatum quam verbis volucre atque incitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:95:325" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 95, 325</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">frĕquentāto</orth>, <hi rend="ital">frequently</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 228, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fresilia: <entryFree id="n18766" type="main" key="Fresili^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fresilĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n18766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of the Marsi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fressus: <entryFree id="n18767" type="main" key="fressus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fressus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">frēsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from frendo.</entryFree>
fretale: <entryFree id="n18768" type="main" key="fre^ta_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĕtāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n18768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a frying-pan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infunditur in fretali piper, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:5:section=275" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 7, 5, § 275</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fretalis: <entryFree id="n18769" type="main" key="fre^ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĕtālis</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fretum</etym>, <sense id="n18769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a strait</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">a Rhaetiarum exordio adusque fretalem Oceanum,</quote> <trans><tr>the English Channel</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fretensis: <entryFree id="n18770" type="main" key="Fre^tensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Frĕtensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. fretum, I. B. 2.</entryFree>
fretum: <entryFree id="n18771" type="main" key="fre^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĕtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">frĕtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root <foreign lang="greek">fru</foreign>, to be in uneasy motion, boil, flash; cf. Sanscr. bhur; Lat. ferveo</etym>, <sense id="n18771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a strait</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">channel.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18771.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18771.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n18771.3" n="(a)" level="5"> Form fretum: <cit><quote lang="la">fretum dictum a similitudine ferventis aquae, quod in fretum saepe concurrat aestus atque differvescat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=22" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 13, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(presteres) freta circum Fervescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid de fretis aut de marinis aestibus plura dicam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 14, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aestus maritimi, fretorumque angustiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:17:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 17, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Seston Abydena separat urbe fretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:28" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fretum Siciliense,</quote> <trans><tr>the Sicilian Strait</tr>, <tr>the Strait of Messina</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 10, 24</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called fretum Siciliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>: <cit><quote lang="la">fretum nostri maris et Oceani,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Gaditanian Strait</tr>, <tr>Strait of Gibraltar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 17, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18771.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Form fretus: salis fretus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 205, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:ib. 27" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> ib. 27</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 12 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">angusto fretu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:720" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 720</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut perangusto fretu divisa servitutis ac libertatis jura cognosceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:66:section=169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 66, § 169</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 20, 15</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">in Scyllaeo illo aeris alieni tamquam in fretu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 8, 18</bibl></cit>: inter Italiam et Siciliam qui est fretus, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 205, 31</bibl>: a Gaditano fretu, Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 103</bibl> P.: angustiae fretus, Messala, ib.: salsi fretus, Licin. ib.—</sense><sense id="n18771.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the Strait</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">the Strait of Sicily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se ille septimo die venisse a freto dixisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:59:section=154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 59, § 154</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 7</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 29, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:7 al" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 7 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n18771.6" n="2" level="3"> Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Frĕtensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fretense mare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Strait of Sicily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18771.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf. </sense><sense id="n18771.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the sea</hi> (syn.: mare, oceanus, pelagus, pontus).—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fervet fretis spirantibus aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 327</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in freta dum fluvii current,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 607</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastor cum traheret per freta navibus Idaeis Helenen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fretis acrior Hadriae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 33, 15</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Euxinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:2" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Libycum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:568" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 568</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n18771.9" n="B" level="2"> Of the sky: (pulvis) omnem pervolat caeli fretum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 205, 29</bibl> (Trag. v. 31 Vahl.).—* </sense><sense id="n18771.10" n="C" level="2"> Of the spring, as the period of transition from cold to heat: <cit><quote lang="la">fretus ipse anni permiscet frigus et aestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 364</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">freta anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 374</bibl></cit> ex conject. Lachm. v. ej. annot. p. 369.—</sense><sense id="n18771.11" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A raging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatis freta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1030" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1030</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fretum adolescentiae, id est secunda imperii aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:26" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiae atque acerbitatis fretum effervescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fretus: <entryFree id="n18772" type="main" key="fre_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root dhar-, Sanscr. dhar-ā-mi, hold, support; v. frēnum</etym>, <sense id="n18772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">leaning</hi> or <hi rend="ital">supported on</hi> something, in a good or bad sense; <hi rend="ital">relying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">depending upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trusting to; daring</hi> (class.; cf.: fultus, nixus).—Constr. with <case>abl.</case>, rarely with <case>dat.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), and with <hi rend="ital">objectclause.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18772.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: omnes mortales dis <pb n="781" /> <cb n="FRIC" /> sunt freti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:38 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 38 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnanimi viri freti virtute et viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dote,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vobis fretus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:42:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 42, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fretus intellegentiā vestrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:19:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 19, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fretus conscientiā officii mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiā Bruti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 21, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:24:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 24, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:430 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 430 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 7:25" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pondere enim fretae (res) stant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1058" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1058</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro et animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 40, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malitiā suā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudine solā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 35, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18772.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (only in Liv.; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Zumpt, Gram. § 413): multitudo hostium, nulli rei praeterquam numero freta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam constantissimae rei, fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 37, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">discordiae hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 31, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec civitas Samnitium infidae adversus Romanos societati freta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 22, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18772.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(naves) pontum irrumpere fretae Longius,</quote> <trans><tr>daring</tr>, <tr>venturing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:23" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18772.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis fretus esse etiam nunc tolerando certamini legatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fretus excipi posse (hostem), qua venturum sciebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:31" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18773" type="main" key="fre_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frētus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. fretus</etym>, <sense id="n18773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">reliance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confidence</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">animi tui fretu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 2:82" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 2, 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18774" type="main" key="fre^tus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĕtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a strait;</hi> v. fretum.</sense></entryFree>
friabilis: <entryFree id="n18775" type="main" key="fri^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĭābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>frio</etym>, <sense id="n18775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">easily broken</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">crumbled to pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tofus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 4, 3, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sandaracha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 18, 55, § 177</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fribusculum: <entryFree id="n18776" type="main" key="fri_buscu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frībuscŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. frigusculum.</entryFree>
fricae: <entryFree id="n18777" type="hapax" key="fri^cae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĭcae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n18777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of stones in Sicily</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Aetn.</author> 526</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fricamentum: <entryFree id="n18778" type="main" key="fri^ca_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĭcāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>frico</etym>, <sense id="n18778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rubbing</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">blando articulorum uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:6:27" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 6, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fricatio: <entryFree id="n18779" type="main" key="fri^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rubbing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rubbing down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friction</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus vertebris utilis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assidua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:12:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehemens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 14, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligens tectoriorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fricator: <entryFree id="n18780" type="main" key="fri^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who rubs</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:7:92" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 7, 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fricatura: <entryFree id="n18781" type="main" key="fri^ca_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĭcātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rubbing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rubbing down</hi> of walls (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">exacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fricatus: <entryFree id="n18782" type="main" key="fri^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĭcātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rubbing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rubbing down</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">emendat dentium vitia crebro fricatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 63, § 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:99" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 15, 30, § 99</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fricium: <entryFree id="n18783" type="hapax" key="fri^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a powder for rubbing the teeth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tooth-powder</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 36</bibl>; cf. dentifricium.</sense></entryFree>
frico: <entryFree id="n18784" type="main" key="fri^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĭco</orth>, <itype>cŭi, ctum, and</itype> (rarely) <itype>fricātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. ghar-, gharsh-, rub; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xri/w, xri=ma</foreign>; Lat. frio; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xri/mptw, xrai/nw</foreign>, to touch, color</etym>, <sense id="n18784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rub</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rub down</hi> (not in Cic. or Caes.; cf.: perfrico, palpo, titillo): mulos qui fricabat, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam concessavimus Lavari aut fricari aut tergeri, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus oleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:90:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 90, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sus) fricat arbore costas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamento dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 58" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra fricata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 6, 76</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: si prurit frictus ocelli Angulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:577" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 577</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alopecias fricuere tunsis caepis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 5, 20, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrima in fricando odora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensae manu sicca fricatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 15, 30, § 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tofus fricatur vento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 22, 48, § 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum duo ligna inter se diutius fricta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:22:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: numquam hercle facerem, genua ni tam nequiter fricares, i. e. <hi rend="ital">rubbed my knees as a suppliant</hi> (shortly before: <cit><quote lang="la">confricantur genua),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 88</bibl></cit>.—In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 94</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:99" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 99</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
frictio: <entryFree id="n18785" type="main" key="fricti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>frico</etym>, <sense id="n18785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rubbing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rubbing down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friction</hi> of parts of the body: <cit><quote lang="la">vehemens, lenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frictionem adhibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frictione uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frictionem lenem admovere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frictrix: <entryFree id="n18786" type="main" key="frictrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frictrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that rubs</hi> (cf. frico <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">post-class.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Res. Carn. 16</bibl>; cf. tribas.</sense></entryFree>
frictura: <entryFree id="n18787" type="hapax" key="frictu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frictūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rubbing</hi>, in mal. part., <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. Fragm. p. 717</bibl> Oud.</sense></entryFree>
frictus: <entryFree id="n18788" type="main" key="frictus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frictus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. <sense id="n18788.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rubbed</hi>, <mood>Part.</mood> of frico.—</sense><sense id="n18788.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Roasted</hi>, <mood>Part.</mood> of frigo.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18789" type="main" key="frictus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frictus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>frico</etym>, <sense id="n18789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rubbing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmularis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 805</bibl></cit>.—In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:322" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 322</bibl>. <cb n="FRIG" /></sense></entryFree>
fridum: <entryFree id="n18790" type="main" key="fridum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fridum</orth>, v. frigidus, A. 2. C.</entryFree>
frigdaria: <entryFree id="n18791" type="main" key="frigdaria"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frigdaria</orth>, v. frigidarius.</entryFree>
frigdor: <entryFree id="n18792" type="main" key="frigdor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frigdor</orth>, v. frigor.</entryFree>
frigedo: <entryFree id="n18793" type="main" key="fri_ge_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frīgēdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>frigeo</etym>, <sense id="n18793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cold</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 139, 11</bibl>, and 206, 21.</sense></entryFree>
frigefacto: <entryFree id="n18794" type="main" key="fri_ge^facto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frīgĕ-facto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>frigeo + facio</etym>, <sense id="n18794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make cold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cool</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">os nunc frigefactas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
frigeo: <entryFree id="n18795" type="main" key="fri_ge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frīgĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>frigus</etym>, <sense id="n18795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be cold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chilly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to freeze</hi> (opp. calere, to be hot, to glow; whereas algere, subject., to feel cold, to freeze, is opp. aestuare, to feel hot; v. caleo and algeo; class.; esp. freq. in the trop. sense). </sense><sense id="n18795.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tange: si non totus friget, me enica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">summosque pedes attinge manusque: Non frigent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:109" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">friget aether,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Aetn.</author> 331</bibl></cit>: corpusque lavant frigentis et unguunt, <hi rend="ital">of him who was cold and stiff</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of the dead</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 219</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelidus tardante senecta sanguis hebet, frigentque effetae in corpore vires,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 396</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18795.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18795.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be inactive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at a standstill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have nothing to do; to be lifeless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">languid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frigid;</hi> of things, <hi rend="ital">to flag</hi>, <hi rend="ital">droop</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in re frigidissima cales, in ferventissima friges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 15, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: quod tibi supra scripsi, Curionem valde frigere, jam calet, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">valde metuo, ne frigeas in hibernis: quamobrem camino luculento utendum censeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigens animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:598" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 598</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum stupere atque frigere... Caecilius visus est!</quote> <trans><tr>to be frigid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:23:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 23, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigere (al. frigida) videntur ista plerisque,</quote> <trans><tr>to be dull</tr>, <tr>frigid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: sermonem quaerere; <cit><quote lang="la">ubi friget, huc evasit, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>flags</tr>, <tr>halts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">Sine Cerere et Libero friget Venus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; also ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18795.4" n="B" level="2"> With respect to the estimation or favor in which a person or thing stands, <hi rend="ital">to be coldly received</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coldly treated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slighted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disregarded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be without power</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare tibicen Antigenidas dixerit discipulo sane frigenti ad populum: Mihi cane et Musis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:50:187" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 50, 187</bibl></cit>: plane jam, Brute, frigeo; <foreign lang="greek">o)/rganon</foreign> enim erat meum senatus; <cit><quote lang="la">id jam est dissolutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nimirum homines frigent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 4, 104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Memmius quidem friget, Scaurum autem jampridem Pompeius abjecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 8, 3</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">Memmius mirum in modum jacet, Scaurus refrixerat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Memmius plane refrixerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 18, 3</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">jacent beneficia Nuculae, friget patronus Antonius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an hoc significas, nihil fieri, frigere te?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima contio Pompei frigebat,</quote> <trans><tr>remained unnoticed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnia consilia frigerent,</quote> <trans><tr>were of no effect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:25:section=60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 25, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin autem ista frigebunt, recipias te ad nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
frigero: <entryFree id="n18796" type="main" key="fri_ge^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frīgĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make cool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to refresh with coolness</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">frigerans Aganippe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigerandi cholerici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:21:208" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 21, 208</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frigesco: <entryFree id="n18797" type="main" key="fri_gesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frīgesco</orth>, <itype>frixi</itype> (frigui, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 52</bibl>, <sense id="n18797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 2), 3, <hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [frigeo], <hi rend="ital">to become</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grow cold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be chilled</hi> (mostly ante-class. and post-Aug.; perh. not used by Cic.). </sense><sense id="n18797.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem addito oleum, postea fervefacito: infundito in catinum, uti frigescat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 1, 156, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigescit terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:865" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 865</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi frigescere pedes manusque intelligit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 70</bibl></cit>; cf.: Ulixi cor frixit prae pavore, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sanguis) cum metu refugit, abit omnis et pallore frigescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigescens vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18797.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18797.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To become inactive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">languid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faint</hi>: si Parthi vos nihil calfaciunt, nos hic frigore frigescimus, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigescit affectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:133" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non patiamur frigescere hoc opus (i. e. miserationem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 29</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n18797.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To become cold towards</hi> any one: <cit><quote lang="la">vide sis, ne majorum tibi forte Limina frigescant,</quote> <trans><tr>receive thee coldly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:109" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 109</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frigida: <entryFree id="n18798" type="main" key="fri_gi^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frīgĭda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. frigidus, I. 2.</entryFree>
frigidarius: <entryFree id="n18799" type="main" key="fri_gi^da_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frīgĭdārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>frigidus</etym>, <sense id="n18799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for cooling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ahenum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to hold cold water</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cella balinei,</quote> <trans><tr>the coolingroom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 6, 25</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">maltha,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cisterna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18799.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">frīgĭdārium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n18799.2" n="A" level="2"> <cb n="FRIG" /> <hi rend="ital">The cooling-room</hi> in a bath, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 11</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n18799.3" n="B" level="2"> In a contr. form: <orth extent="full" lang="la">frigdāria</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a cold larder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provision-room</hi>: mercem in frigdaria ferre, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 909</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
frigidatio: <entryFree id="n18800" type="main" key="fri_gi^da_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frīgĭdātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>frigido</etym>, <sense id="n18800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chilling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chilliness</hi>, translation of Gr. <foreign lang="greek">yuxro/ths</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Categor. Decem. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
frigide: <entryFree id="n18801" type="main" key="fri_gi^de"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frīgĭde</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. frigidus <sense id="n18801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
frigidefacto: <entryFree id="n18802" type="main" key="fri_gi^de^facto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frīgĭdĕ-facto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, false read. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 39</bibl>, inst. of frigefacto, q. v.</entryFree>
frigiditas: <entryFree id="n18803" type="main" key="fri_gi^di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frīgĭdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n18803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the cold</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
frigidiusculus: <entryFree id="n18804" type="hapax" key="fri_gi^di^uscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frīgĭdĭuscŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n18804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [frigidus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat frigid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia quoque ibidem congerit frigidiuscula,</quote> <trans><tr>rather flat</tr>, <tr>stupid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:10:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 10, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frigido: <entryFree id="n18805" type="main" key="fri_gi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frīgĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make cold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cool</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:17" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumbum tactu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membranam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 1:17:168" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 168</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frigidulus: <entryFree id="n18806" type="main" key="fri_gi^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frīgĭdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n18806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">somewhat cold</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ocelli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 347</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n18806.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Somewhat feeble</hi> or <hi rend="ital">faint</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">singultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 131</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frigidus: <entryFree id="n18807" type="main" key="fri_gi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frīgĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>frigeo</etym>, <sense id="n18807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chilling</hi> (opp. calidus; syn.: gelidus, algidus, glacialis; corresp. in most of its senses to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">yuxro/s</foreign>). </sense><sense id="n18807.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">calida et frigida, et amara et dulcia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons luce diurnā Frigidus, et calidus nocturno tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:849" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 849</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:ib. 6:873" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 873</bibl></cit>; 879; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidior umor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:840" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 840</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:844" default="NO" valid="yes">844</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ullum hoc frigidius flumen attigi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nec frigidior Thracam ambiat Hebrus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca frigidissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Praeneste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tempe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 469</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquilo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 404</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 16, 36</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">manet sub Jove frigido Venator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum est hieme frigidum et gelidum,</quote> <trans><tr>cold and frosty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidus aëra vesper Temperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 336</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidus latet anguis in herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 3, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anguis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 71</bibl></cit> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">yuxro\n o)/fin</foreign>, Theogn. 602; <cit><quote lang="la">Theocr. 15, 58): pellis duraque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febris,</quote> <trans><tr>an ague</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 71, § 289</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quartana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fomenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 26</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille frigidas Noctes non sine multis Insomnis lacrimis agit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>without a bedfellow</tr>, <tr>lonely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidus annus,</quote> <trans><tr>winter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 311</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:8:4" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 8, 4</bibl> Huschke (al. amnis).—Prov.: aquam frigidam suffundere, <hi rend="ital">to pour cold water over</hi> for <hi rend="ital">to slander</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 37</bibl>; v. suffundo.—</sense><sense id="n18807.2" n="2" level="3"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18807.3" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">frīgĭdum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the cold</hi>: obaequalitas ferventis ac frigidi, Apul. Dog. Plat. 1, p. 11, 24.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigida (opp. calida),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18807.4" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">frī-gĭda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. aqua), <hi rend="ital">cold water</hi> (like calida or calda, ae, warm water): <cit><quote lang="la">frigida lavare lubenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidam bibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidam aegro dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidā lavari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxia ut frigidam febri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18807.5" n="c" level="4"> In a contracted form: <itype>FRIDVM, i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: DA FRIDVM PVSILLVM, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a little ice-water</hi>, Inscr. Pompej. in Mus. Borbon. IV. p. 5 (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">solve nives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:64" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 64</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n18807.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">cold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chilled</hi>, of a dead person, or one stiffened with fright (for the latter cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">est et frigida multa, comes formidinis aura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 290</bibl></cit>; <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">illa (Eurydice) Stygiā nabat jam frigida cymbā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 506</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 136</bibl>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">transf.: Eurydicen vox ipsa et frigida lingua, Ah, miseram Eurydicen! anima fugiente vocabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:525" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 525</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra nati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:743" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 743</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 385</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:26" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 26</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pausa vitaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:930" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 930</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stricto Aesonides stans frigidus ense,</quote> <trans><tr>stiffened with fright</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:530" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles nec frigidus aspicit hostem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>fearless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:49" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 49</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">formidine turpi Frigida corda tremunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:339" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 339</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigida mens criminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:166" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi frigidus horror Membra quatit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n18807.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18807.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Without ardor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">encrgy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frigid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indifferent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inactive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remiss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indolent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feeble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis lentus in dicendo et paene frigidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:48:178" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 48, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusatoribus frigidissimis utitur,</quote> <trans><tr>lukewarm</tr>, <tr>indolent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non frigida virgo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>glowing with love</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidus aevo Laomedontiades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:325" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 325</bibl></cit>: (equus) Frigidus in Venerem senior, Verg. <pb n="782" /> <cb n="FRIG" /> G. 3, 97: <cit><quote lang="la">(Empedocles) ardentem Frigidus Aetnam Insiluit,</quote> <trans><tr>in cold blood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in re frigidissima cales, in ferventissima friges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 15, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidae litterae,</quote> <trans><tr>cold</tr>, <tr>frigid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:2:45" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 2, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1060" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1060</bibl></cit> (with which cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">curarum frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:9:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 9, 25</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">frigida bello Dextera,</quote> <trans><tr>feeble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensis,</quote> <trans><tr>inactive</tr>, <tr>idle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 245</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:502" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 502</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(apes) Contemnuntque favos et frigida tecta relinquunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>not animated by labor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 104</bibl></cit> (cf. opp. fervet opus, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 169</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n18807.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Without force</hi> or <hi rend="ital">point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insipid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trivial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frigid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vain</hi> (syn.: jejunus, inanis; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. salsus, facetus, esp. in post-Aug. prose): cave in ista tam frigida, tam jejuna calumnia delitescas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:21:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 21, 61</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec aut frigida sunt, aut tum salsa, cum aliud est exspectatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:64:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 64, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sententias) dicere leves, frigidas ineptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba frigidiora vitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:63:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 63, 256</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:26:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 26, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidi et arcessiti joci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud frigidum et inane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud apud Euripidem frigidum sane, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigida et puerilis affectatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigida et inanis affectatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus acuminis in reprehendendis verbis, nonnumquam frigidum, interdum etiam facetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:67:236" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 67, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in salibus aliquando frigidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies frigidis rebus absumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 9:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ista frigida et inania videntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 4:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 17, 4</bibl></cit>; Sen. de Ira, 2, 11.— With a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leve ac frigidum sit his addere, quo propinquos amicosque pacto tractaverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 26</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n18807.10" n="C" level="2"> With active meaning, <hi rend="ital">causing cold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frightening</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidus a rostris manat per compita rumor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 50</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">frīgĭde</orth> (only acc. to II. and very rare; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n18807.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Inactively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slowly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feebly</hi>: quae cupiunt, tamen ita frigide agunt, ut nolle existimentur, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 10, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18807.12" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Flatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trivially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insipidly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frigidly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis inepte et frigide uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with inaniter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 43</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with exigue, opp. graviter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 19, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: quae sunt dicta frigidius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transire in diversa subsellia, parum verecundum est ... Et si aliquando concitate itur, numquam non frigide reditur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in a silly</tr>, <tr>ridiculous manner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:133" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum ille infantem suam frigidissime reportavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frigilla: <entryFree id="n18808" type="main" key="fri_gilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frīgilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. fringilla.</entryFree>
frigo: <entryFree id="n18809" type="main" key="fri_go1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frīgo</orth>, <itype>xi</itype> (acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 369</bibl> P.), ctum (frixum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 14</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">fru/gw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n18809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to roast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fry</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">torreo, coquo): sesquilibram salis frigito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R.
