R. 106, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frictae nuces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigunt hordeum, deinde molis frangunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 14, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Med. 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triticum frictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frictum panicum, milium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frictum cicer, nux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fricta faba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 69, § 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova fricta ex oleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 3, 11, § 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simila frixa in sartagine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:6:21 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 6, 21 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n18809.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tam frictum ego illum reddam, quam frictumst cicer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 249</bibl> supra.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18810" type="hapax" key="fri^go2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĭgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>the root of friguttio</etym>, to denote the natural sound of little children, <sense id="n18810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to squeak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squeal</hi>: Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 308, 16</bibl> (Fragm. Com. v. 247 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18811" type="main" key="fri^go3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĭgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, acc. to Novius, i. q. erigo, <sense id="n18811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to erect</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 308, 7 sq.</bibl> and 7, 10 (Fragm. Trag. v. 441, 463 Rib.); Varr. ib.</sense></entryFree>
frigor: <entryFree id="n18812" type="main" key="fri_gor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frīgor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>frigeo</etym>, <sense id="n18812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cold</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">molestissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 2, 29</bibl></cit>.—Also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">frigdor</orth> (contr. from frigidor, from frigidus], <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 2, 16</bibl>; id. de Diaet.</sense></entryFree>
frigorificus: <entryFree id="n18813" type="main" key="fri_go^ri^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frīgŏrĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>frigus+facio</etym>, <sense id="n18813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cooling</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">acetum omnium maxime frigorificum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:8:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 8, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frigoro: <entryFree id="n18814" type="main" key="fri_go^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frīgŏro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>frigus</etym>, <sense id="n18814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cool down</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cholericos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:4" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:21:208" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Acut. 3, 21, 208</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
frigulo: <entryFree id="n18815" type="main" key="fri^gu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĭgŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, a word denoting the natural note of the jackdaw: graculus at frigulat, Auct. Carm. Philom. 28.</entryFree>
frigus: <entryFree id="n18816" type="main" key="fri_gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frīgus</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">r(i=gos</foreign>, cold, <foreign lang="greek">p(ige/w</foreign>; <cit><quote lang="la">the connection with Lat. rĭgeo, rĭgor, is doubtful,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. 353" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. 353</bibl></cit>; Corss. Ausspr. 1, 451</etym>, <sense id="n18816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coldness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coolness</hi> (for <cb n="FRIG" /> syn. cf.: algor, gelu, rigor, glacies, pruina). </sense><sense id="n18816.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18816.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec calor (mihi obsistet) nec frigus metuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. calor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 517</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:371" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 371</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 14 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:45:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 45, 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 344</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calidis torrescere flammis aut ... rigere Frigore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:892" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 892</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum esset vinctus nudus in aëre, in imbri, in frigore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:40:section=87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 40, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix in ipsis tectis frigus vitatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fere matutinis temporibus frigus est,</quote> <trans><tr>coolness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus captabis opacum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 13, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 129</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae frigore sola Dormiat,</quote> <trans><tr>in the cold night</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:39" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Appius senatum coegisset, tantum fuit frigus ut coactus sit nos dimittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec frigora quimus usurpare oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tectis saepti frigora caloresque pellamus,</quote> <trans><tr>the cold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:151" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 151</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex verna intemperie variante calores frigoraque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta quibus frigorum vis pellitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:4:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter frigora ... frumenta in agris matura non erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpinae nives et frigora Rheni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scythiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Peligna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 19, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matutina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 22, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intolerabilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:58:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 58, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficum frigoribus ne serito,</quote> <trans><tr>in cold weather</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisquam picta colit Spartani frigora saxi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the variegated cold marble floor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:56:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 56, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 81</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18816.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n18816.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The cold of winter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winter</hi> (like calor for summer; <cit><quote lang="la">v. calor): lac mihi non aestate novum, non frigore defit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante focum, si frigus erit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae frigore sola dormiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:39" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per medium frigus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigoribus parto agricolae plerumque fruuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigoribus mediis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 10, 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18816.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A chill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fever</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentatum frigore corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 80</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18816.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The coldness of death</hi>, <hi rend="ital">death</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et gelidos artus in leti frigore linquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 401</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeternum leti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:924" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 924</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">letale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 611</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supremum animae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:20" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ast illi solvuntur frigore membra Vitaque cum gemitu fugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:951" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 951</bibl></cit> (diff. from the foll.).—</sense><sense id="n18816.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A cold shudder</hi> produced by fear: <cit><quote lang="la">extemplo Aeneae solvuntur frigore membra, Ingemit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 92</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18816.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a cold region</hi> or <hi rend="ital">place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus non habitabile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:51" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et quodcumque jacet sub urbe frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:64:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 64, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18816.9" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (cf. frigeo and frigidus, II.; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n18816.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Coldness in action</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inactivity</hi>: si Parthi vos nihil calfaciunt, nos hic frigore frigescimus, etc., Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:856" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 856</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18816.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A cold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">frigid reception</hi> of a person or thing, esp. a discourse; <hi rend="ital">coolness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coldness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indifference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disfavor</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">majorum ne quis amicus Frigore te feriat,</quote> <trans><tr>coolness</tr>, <tr>loss of favor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Montanus Julius et amicitia Tiberii notus et frigore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 122" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et imperitia et rusticitas et rigor et deformitas afferunt interim frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud quaestionum et argumentorum apud corrupta judicia frigus evitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 12, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frigusculum: <entryFree id="n18817" type="main" key="fri_guscu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frīguscŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>frigus</etym>, <sense id="n18817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slight cold</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n18817.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Anim. 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18817.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">coolness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">variance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disagreement</hi> between man and wife: <cit><quote lang="la">quid si divortium non intercesserit, sed frigusculum? profecto valebit donatio, si frigusculum quievit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:32:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 1, 32, § 12</bibl></cit> (al. fribusculum).</sense></entryFree>
frigutio: <entryFree id="n18818" type="main" key="fri^gu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĭgūtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">frĭguttio, fringūtio, frĭgultio, fringultio</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fringulo</orth>), <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n18818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [a lengthened form of 2. frigo], <hi rend="ital">to twitter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chirp.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18818.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of birds: <cit><quote lang="la">merulae in remotis tesquis frigutiunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 358, 22</bibl></cit>: fringulit et graculus, Poët. ap. Anthol. Lat, 5, 43, 124.—</sense><sense id="n18818.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of a person who speaks indistinctly, <hi rend="ital">to stammer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stutter.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18818.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">murmurare potius et friguttire quam clangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:de Eloqu. p. 229" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> de Eloqu. p. 229</bibl></cit> ed. Mai.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe in rebus nequaquam difficilibus fringultiat vel omnino obmutescat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 296, 21</bibl></cit>: haec anus admodum frigultit, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> 562, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid friguttis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 49</bibl></cit> (also ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=104" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 104</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n18818.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stammer forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix singulas syllabas fringutiens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 336, 18</bibl></cit>. <cb n="FRON" /></sense></entryFree>
fringilla: <entryFree id="n18819" type="main" key="fringilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fringilla</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">frigilla</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">frin-guilla</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n18819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small bird</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the robin redbreast</hi>, Motacilla rubecula, Linn.; acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">the chaffinch</hi>, Fringilla coelebs, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=104" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:55:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 55, 7</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=90" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 90</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
fringultio: <entryFree id="n18820" type="main" key="fringultio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fringultio</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">fringūtio</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, v. frigutio.</entryFree>
friniates: <entryFree id="n18821" type="main" key="Frini^a_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Frinĭātes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Ligurian people on the northern slope of the Apennines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes">9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
frio: <entryFree id="n18822" type="main" key="fri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n18822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rub</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crumble into small pieces</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra, quae facile frietur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:9:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glaebis terrarum saepe friatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:888" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 888</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut inter se tritum tarde frietur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 19, 42, § 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:117" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 12, 29, § 117</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut gemma in micas frietur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">friatum amomum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 13, 28, § 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frisii: <entryFree id="n18823" type="main" key="Fri_si^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Frīsĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">fri/sioi</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">frei/sioi</foreign>, Ptol. and Dio Cass., in the Middle Ages Frisones and Fresones, <sense id="n18823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Frisians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a people of northern Germany</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the Rhine and the Ems</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the modern West Friesland</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 15, 27, § 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 72 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Frīsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Frisian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
frit: <entryFree id="n18824" type="main" key="frit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frit</orth> (<gen>n.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype>) vocatur illud summa in spica jam matura, quod est minus quam granum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:48:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 48, 3</bibl>.</entryFree>
fritilla: <entryFree id="n18825" type="main" key="fritilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fritilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. fitilla.</entryFree>
fritillus: <entryFree id="n18826" type="main" key="fri^tillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĭtillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a box from which the dice were thrown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dice-box</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:1:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:14:8" default="NO">4, 14, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:5" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 5</bibl>; Sen. Apocol. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fritinnio: <entryFree id="n18827" type="main" key="fri^tinni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĭtinnĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n18827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to twitter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chirp</hi> as a small bird. </sense><sense id="n18827.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: et pullos peperit fritinnientes, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 7, 15</bibl>; of the cicada: et cuculi cuculant et rauca cicada fritinnit, Auct. Carm. Phil. 35.—</sense><sense id="n18827.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the noise made by young children: sic dulci Marcus qui nunc sermone fritinnit, Poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> I. p. 603</bibl> ed. Burm.</sense></entryFree>
frivolaria: <entryFree id="n18828" type="main" key="Fri_vo^la_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Frīvŏlārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n18828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the title of a comedy of Plautus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of which only a few fragments have been preserved.</hi></sense></entryFree>
frivolus: <entryFree id="n18829" type="main" key="fri_vo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frīvŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; perh. from frico</etym>, <sense id="n18829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">silly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">empty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trifling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frivolous; pitiful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sorry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthless</hi> (mostly post-Aug.; perh. not in Cic.; cf. futtilis). </sense><sense id="n18829.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frivolus hic quidem jam et illiberalis est sermo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 11, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levibus aut frivolis aut manifesto falsis reum incessere (shortly after: quia, qui vana congerit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colligitis lexidia, res taetras et inanes et frivolas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frivola et inanis argutiola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:7:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam dicit futtilia et frivola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:12:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jocus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 19, 79, § 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auspicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insolentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactantia in parvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 6, 7, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 31" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 3, 7, § 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">origo superbissimi animalium (i. e. hominis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 7, 5, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratione morientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 29, 35, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flunt in litterarum ostentatione inepti et frivoli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:30:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 30, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in cognoscendo ac decernendo nonnumquam frivolus amentique similis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin etiam, quod est imprimis frivolum ac scaenicum, verbum petant (declamatores), quo incipiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frivolum dictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frivolum videatur, non tamen omittendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 12, 50, § 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic misit qui nescio quid frivoli ducentis milibus traderet,</quote> <trans><tr>some worthless thing</tr>, <tr>trifle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n18829.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">frīvŏla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">wretched furniture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paltry things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trifles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter frivola mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:11:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 7, 11, § 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam poscit aquam: jam frivola transfert Ucalegon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:198" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 198</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:59" default="NO">5, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:11:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 7, 11, § 5</bibl>; cf.: frivola <foreign lang="greek">skeua/ria eu)telh= pa/nu</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">frī-vŏlē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a silly manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triflingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliqui mentiuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Mich. II. 7, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frixo: <entryFree id="n18830" type="main" key="frixo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frixo</orth>, <itype>āvi</itype>, <sense id="n18830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [1. frigo], <hi rend="ital">to roast thoroughly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:11:77" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 11, 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
frixorium: <entryFree id="n18831" type="main" key="frixo_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frixōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a frying-pan</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; cf. frixorium, <foreign lang="greek">th/ganon</foreign>, Vet. Gloss. Cf. the foll. art.</sense></entryFree>
frixura: <entryFree id="n18832" type="main" key="frixu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frixūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a frying-pan</hi>, Ven. Carm. 6, 10, 13. Cf. the preced. art.</sense></entryFree>
frixus: <entryFree id="n18833" type="main" key="frixus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frixus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 1. frigo.</entryFree>
frondarius: <entryFree id="n18834" type="hapax" key="fronda_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frondārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. frons</etym>, <sense id="n18834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> <pb n="783" /> <cb n="FRON" /> or <hi rend="ital">for leaves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leaf-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fiscinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 314</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frondatio: <entryFree id="n18835" type="hapax" key="fronda_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frondātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. frons</etym>, <sense id="n18835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stripping off of leaves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pruning</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
frondator: <entryFree id="n18836" type="main" key="fronda_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frondātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who strips off leaves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a leaf-stripper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dresser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pruner</hi> of trees, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:649" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 649</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 314</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
frondeo: <entryFree id="n18837" type="main" key="fronde^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frondĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to have</hi> or <hi rend="ital">put forth leaves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be in leaf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become green</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jam per terras frondent atque omnia florent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc frondent silvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 6, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis multa materia frondens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:1:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondentia arbuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">examen ramo frondente pependit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 67</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: frondenti tempora ramo Implicat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondens campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondere Philemona Baucis, Baucida conspexit senior frondere Philemon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:714 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 714 sq.</bibl></cit>: frondem ac flores addidit; Non lanas, sed velatas frondentes comas, i. e. <hi rend="ital">crowned with leaves</hi>, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=24" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
frondesco: <entryFree id="n18838" type="main" key="frondesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frondesco</orth>, <itype>dŭi</itype> (acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 768</bibl> P.), 3, <sense id="n18838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [frondeo], <hi rend="ital">to become leafy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put forth leaves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shoot out.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18838.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): caelum nitescere, arbores frondescere, Vites pampinis pubescere, etc., Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 69</bibl> (Trag. v. 192 ed. Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1092" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1092</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia hieme nudata, verno tempore tepefacta frondescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:13:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum subito vidit frondescere Romulus hastam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:561" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 561</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:395" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 395</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simili frondescit virga metallo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 144</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n18838.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech, <hi rend="ital">to be flowery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio verborum compositione frondescat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 36, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frondeus: <entryFree id="n18839" type="main" key="fronde^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frondĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. frons</etym>, <sense id="n18839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of leaves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covered with leaves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leafy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romulus frondea (corona) coronavit Hostilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 4, 5, § 11</bibl></cit>: tecta, <hi rend="ital">leafy coverts</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">trees in full leaf</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">casa,</quote> <trans><tr>covered with leaves</tr>, <tr>embowered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:528" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 528</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuspis,</quote> <trans><tr>a toothpick cut from a twig</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:22" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frondicomus: <entryFree id="n18840" type="hapax" key="frondi^co^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frondĭcŏmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. fronscoma</etym>, <sense id="n18840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">leafy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locis habitare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 102</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frondifer: <entryFree id="n18841" type="main" key="frondi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frondĭfer</orth> (anciently also <orth extent="full" lang="la">frund-</orth>), <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. frons-fero</etym>, <sense id="n18841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">leaf-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leafy</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): frundiferi loci, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 323, 1</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 25 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 359</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Sen Oedip. 276: silvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus avium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frondifluus: <entryFree id="n18842" type="hapax" key="frondi^flu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frondĭflŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. frons-fluo</etym>, <sense id="n18842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">leaf-falling</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">when the leaves fall off</hi>: brumae frigore, Boëth. Cons. 1, 5, 14.</sense></entryFree>
frondosus: <entryFree id="n18843" type="main" key="frondo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frondōsus</orth> (anciently also <orth extent="full" lang="la">frund-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. frons</etym>, <sense id="n18843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of leaves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leafy</hi>: omne sonabat Arbustum fremitu silvaï frondosaï, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ann. v. 197</bibl> Vahl.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertex (collis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 351</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 410</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taxus frondosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:596" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 596</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frons: <entryFree id="n18844" type="main" key="frons1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frons</orth> (also anciently <orth extent="full" lang="la">fruns</orth>; <number>plur.</number> frundes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:266" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 266</bibl> Vahl.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 105</bibl> P.—Also in <case>nom.</case> <orth extent="full" lang="la">fros</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">frus</orth>, Varr. ib.; Enn. v in the foll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 554</bibl> P.; and FRONDIS, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 2, 372</bibl>), <itype>dis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.</etym>, <sense id="n18844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leafy branch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">green bough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foliage.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18844.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.; in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>; syn. folium). </sense><sense id="n18844.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: populea frus, Enn. ap. Aus. Technop. (Edyll. 5) 158 sq. (<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ann. v. 562</bibl> Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ilignea, quernea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 37, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nemoribus, ubi virgulta et frons multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bobus praestabit vilicus frondem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:101" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 101</bibl></cit>: alta frons decidit, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 486, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne caules allii in frondem luxurient,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 34, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perenni frunde corona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigrae feraci frondis in Algido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine fronde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:75" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immaturam destringere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18844.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: russescunt frundes, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 105</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 266 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">deserta via et inculta atque interclusa jam frondibus et virgultis relinquatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:18:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viminibus salices fecundi, frondibus ulmi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 446</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondibus teneris non adhibendam esse falcem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bovemque Disjunctum curas et strictis frondibus exples,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:18:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 18, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18844.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., <hi rend="ital">a garland made of leafy boughs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a garland of leaves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leafy chaplet</hi>: donec Alterutrum velox victoria <cb n="FRON" /> fronde coronet, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 64</bibl>; so in <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 110</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos delubra deum festa velamus fronde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 249</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 661</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 449</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">565</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 108</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:711" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 711</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 482</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18845" type="main" key="frons2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frons</orth>, <itype>frontis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<sense id="n18845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:9:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 9, 5</bibl>; and ap. Fest. s. v. recto, p. 286, b, Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 46</bibl> Ritschl, <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 205, 4</bibl>; Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:9:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 17</bibl>) [cf. Sanscr. brhū; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)fru/s</foreign>; Germ. Braue; Engl. brow; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 296" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 296</bibl>], <hi rend="ital">the forehead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">front</hi> (syn.: vultus, os, facies). </sense><sense id="n18845.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons et aliis (animalibus), sed homini tantum tristitiae, hilaritatis, clementiae, severitatis index: in adsensu ejus supercilia homini et pariter et alterna mobilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 51, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta erat gravitas in oculo, tanta contractio frontis, ut illo supercilio res publica, tamquam Atlante caelum, niti videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: frontem contrahere, <hi rend="ital">to contract</hi> or <hi rend="ital">knit the brows</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 26, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 125</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, adducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 6:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 7</bibl></cit>: remittere frontem, <hi rend="ital">to smooth the brow</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to cheer up</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 5, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: exporge frontem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 53</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">primum ego te porrectiore fronte volo mecum loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">explicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:183" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 183</bibl></cit>: ut frontem ferias, <hi rend="ital">smitest thy forehead</hi> (as a sign of vexation), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla perturbatio animi, nulla corporis, frons non percussa, non femur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:80:278" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 80, 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femur, pectus, frontem caedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontem sudario tergere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 60</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: siccare frontem sudario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:148" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillos a fronte retroagere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 160" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediam ferro gemina inter tempora frontem Dividit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:750" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 750</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorundam capita per medium frontis et verticis mucrone distincta, in utrumque humerum pendebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insignem tenui fronte Lycorida (a small forehead was regarded as a beauty by the ancients),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 33, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:42:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 42, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 72</bibl>.—Of the forehead of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">est bos cervi figura: cujus a media fronte, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauri torva fronte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:9:30" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui (haedo) frons turgida cornibus Primis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vitulus) Fronte curvatos imitatus ignes lunae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 57</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1034" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1034</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n18845.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The brow</hi> as a mirror of the feelings: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum ex oratione, sed etiam ex vultu et oculis et fronte, ut aiunt, meum erga te amorem perspicere potuisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 13</bibl></cit>, B, 1; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 11:44" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 11, 44</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">homines fronte et oratione magis, quam ipso beneficio reque capiuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>expression of countenance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:ib. 12:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si verum tum, cum verissima fronte, dixerunt, nunc mentiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ipsa fero equidem fronte et vultu bellissime, sed angor intimis sensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: frons, oculi, vultus persaepe mentiuntur; <cit><quote lang="la">oratio vero saepissime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. F. 1, 1, 5, § 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi, supercilia, frons, vultus denique totus, qui sermo quidam tacitus mentis est, hic in fraudem homines impulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fronte occultare sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 18, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquilla et serena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:15:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 15, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquiae pristinae frontis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laeta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:862" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 862</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:33" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:41:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 41, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humana, lenis, placida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inverecunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proterva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbana (i. e. impudens),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impudens, proterva, Aug. Op. imperf. c. Jul. 6, 21: impudentissima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">impudentia frontis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Rufin. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fronte inverecunda nummos captare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:2:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">si populo grata est tabella, quae frontes aperit hominum, mentes tegat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 6, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18845.3" n="3" level="3"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">frons occipitio prior est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>better work before the master's face than behind his back</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 5, 6, § 31</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n18845.4" n="B" level="2"> Transf </sense><sense id="n18845.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The forepart</hi> of any thing, <hi rend="ital">the front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">façade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">van</hi> (opp. tergum and latus): <cit><quote lang="la">copias ante frontem castrorum struit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 37, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">januae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:135" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(navium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:9:4" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis ex utraque parte lateris dejectus habebat, et in frontem leniter fastigatus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 23</bibl>: intervallum justum arborum quadrageni<cb n="FROS" />  pedes in terga frontemque, in latera viceni, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 202</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">octo cohortes in fronte constituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 59:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 59, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quatuor legionum aquilae per frontem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">una fronte contra hostem castra muniunt,</quote> <trans><tr>only in front</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:80:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 80, 2</bibl></cit> Herz.: <cit><quote lang="la">aequa fronte ad pugnam procedebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:44:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 44, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tamen aequari frontes poterant, cum extenuando infirmam mediam aciem haberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 38, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recta fronte concurrere hosti (opp. in dextrum cornu),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">directa fronte pugnandum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritus ne simul in frontem simul et latera suorum pugnaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transisse aestuaria pulchrum ac decorum in frontem (i. e. fronti),</quote> <trans><tr>for the front</tr>, <tr>the van</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 33</bibl></cit>: dextra fronte prima legio incessit, <hi rend="ital">on the right front</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">on the right wing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laeva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 2, 174</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">frons laevi cornu haec erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., of clouds: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non tam concurrere nubes Frontibus adversis possint quam de latere ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 117</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a precipice: Fronte sub adversa scopulis pendentibus antrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 166</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq.: a fronte, <hi rend="ital">in front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">before</hi> (opp. a tergo and a latere): <cit><quote lang="la">a tergo, a fronte, a lateribus tenebitur, si in Galliam venerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a fronte atque ab utroque latere cratibus ac pluteis protegebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totis fere a fronte et ab sinistra parte nudatis castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 23, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n18845.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The outer end of a book-roll</hi> or <hi rend="ital">volume</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:1:13" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:11" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18845.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The circumference of a wheel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18845.8" n="4" level="3"> In measuring land = latitudo, <hi rend="ital">the breadth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille pedes in fronte, trecentos cippus in agrum Hic dabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4558</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4560</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18845.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18845.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The outside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exterior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">external quality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appearance</hi> (cf. species and facies; <cit><quote lang="la">mostly post-Aug.): Pompeius Scauro studet: sed utrum fronte an mente, dubitatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 15, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus habet in recessu, quam fronte promittat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:61" default="NO">11, 1, 61</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">frons causae non satis honesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 42</bibl></cit> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">decipit Frons prima multos,</quote> <trans><tr>the first appearance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dura primā fronte quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex prima statim fronte dijudicare imprudentium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 7, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18845.11" n="B" level="2"> The character or feelings expressed by the brow. </sense><sense id="n18845.12" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> in partic., <hi rend="ital">shame</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exclamet perisse Frontem de rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:104" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 104</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">clament periisse pudorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 80</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n18845.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Impudence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boldness</hi> (late Lat.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">os),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 3:30" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 3, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frontalia: <entryFree id="n18846" type="main" key="fronta_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frontālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>2. frons</etym>, <sense id="n18846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ornament for the forehead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frontlet</hi>, of horses, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 40, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 12, 74, § 194</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
frontati: <entryFree id="n18847" type="main" key="fronta_ti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frontāti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. lapides) [2. frons, I. B. 1.], in architect., <sense id="n18847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stones that go from one side of a wall to the other</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and are faced both ways</hi>, <hi rend="ital">binding-stones</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copingstones</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
frontinus: <entryFree id="n18848" type="main" key="Fronti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Frontīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname.</hi> So esp., Sex. Julius Frontinus, <hi rend="ital">superintendent of the Roman aqueducts under Nerva</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the latter half of the first century of the Christian era; author of the works</hi> De Aquis Urbis Romae, Strategetica, De Agrorum Qualitate, and De Limitibus Agrorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:48:20" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 48, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 19, 1</bibl>; v. Teuffel, Röm. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 322.</sense></entryFree>
fronto: <entryFree id="n18849" type="main" key="fronto1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fronto</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n18849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">amplif.</hi> [2. frons], <hi rend="ital">one who has a broad forehead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquos naevum habere? ecquos silos, flaccos, frontones, capitones?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:29:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 29, 80</bibl></cit>.—Hence,</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18850" type="main" key="Fronto2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fronto</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper name.</hi> So esp.: M. Cornelius Fronto, <hi rend="ital">a famous Roman orator from Cirta</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Numidia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who lived about</hi> A. D. 90-168. <hi rend="ital">Small portions of his writings have been discovered in palimpsests by Angelo Mai.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n18850.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Frontōnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Fronto</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Frontonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decreta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:2:99" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 2, 99</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Frontōnĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">pupils of Fronto</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Frontonians</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
frontosus: <entryFree id="n18851" type="main" key="fronto_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frontōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. frons</etym>, <sense id="n18851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">manybrowed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having several foreheads.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18851.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, said of Janus: <cit><quote lang="la">frontosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n18851.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that has a bold forehead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shameless</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. in Psa. 1:68" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. in Psa. 1, 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fros: <entryFree id="n18852" type="main" key="fros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fros</orth>, v. 1. frons <sense id="n18852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi> <pb n="784" /> <cb n="FRUC" /></sense></entryFree>
fructeta: <entryFree id="n18853" type="main" key="fructe_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fructēta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, a later form for frutecta, <sense id="n18853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bushes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thickets</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbusta, fructeta scholastici vocabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 1, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fructifer: <entryFree id="n18854" type="main" key="fructi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fructĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fructus + fero</etym>, <sense id="n18854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fruit-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruitful</hi> (post-Aug. for the class. frugifer): <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:46" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 112</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarmentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 29, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 14, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fructificatio: <entryFree id="n18855" type="main" key="fructi^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fructĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fructifico</etym>, <sense id="n18855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bearing of fruit</hi> (post - class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
fructifico: <entryFree id="n18856" type="main" key="fructi^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fructĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>fructus+facio</etym>, <sense id="n18856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bear fruit</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">laurus fructificat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:91" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:4:20 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 4, 20 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
fructuarius: <entryFree id="n18857" type="main" key="fructu^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fructŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fructus</etym>. <sense id="n18857.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to fruit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruit-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruitful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:29" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 181</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami olcae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:18:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars villae,</quote> <trans><tr>that serves for laying up the fruits in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 1</bibl></cit> and 9: <cit><quote lang="la">scrofa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: agri, <hi rend="ital">for which a portion of the produce is paid</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 9, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18857.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to usufruct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usufructuary</hi> (jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">servus,</quote> <trans><tr>of whom one has merely the usufruct</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:37" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:63" default="NO">63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 7, 3</bibl>: stipulati, <hi rend="ital">a stipulation by a litigant in possession</hi> ad interim, <hi rend="ital">by which he shall repay twice the mesne profits if finally defeated in the suit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:166" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <trans><tr>a special mode of procedure for receiving mesne profits</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:169" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 169</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18857.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fructŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">fructŭārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, in an act. sense, <hi rend="ital">one who has the usufruct</hi> of a thing, <hi rend="ital">a usufructuary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:22 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 22 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24" default="NO">24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:58 al" default="NO">58 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
fructuose: <entryFree id="n18858" type="main" key="fructu^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fructŭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. fructuosus <sense id="n18858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fructuosus: <entryFree id="n18859" type="main" key="fructu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fructŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fructus, 2.</etym>, <sense id="n18859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abounding in fruit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">productive; profitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advantageous</hi> (very freq. and class.; syn.: fertilis, frugifer). </sense><sense id="n18859.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager quamvis fertilis sine cultura fructuosus esse non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ager optimus et fructuosissimus Corinthius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedia tam pulchra, tam fructuosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 15, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus opportunissimus ac fructuosissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructuosissimae insulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:32:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 32, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat ei pecuaria res ampla et rustica sane bene culta et fructuosa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">arationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:39:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 39, 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:65" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 65</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18859.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tota philosophia frugifera et fructuosa, nec ulla pars ejus inculta ac deserta sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerique neque in rebus humanis quicquam bonum norunt nisi quod fructuosum sit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutes generi hominum fructuosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:84:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 84, 344</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus aliis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 85, 346</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est non modo liberale paulum nonnumquam de suo jure decedere sed interdum etiam fructuosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 18, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M.
