Caelius se esse hominem frugi vult probare, non quia abstinens sit, sed quia utilis multis, id est fructuosus, unde sic dicta frugalitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructuosior dos, opp. deterior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 6, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">17</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fructŭ-ōse</orth>, <hi rend="ital">profitably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advantageously</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc nec dici brevius nec agi fructuosius potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 77" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fructus: <entryFree id="n18860" type="main" key="fructus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fructus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from fruor.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18861" type="main" key="fructus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fructus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (archaic <sense id="n18861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> fructuis, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 492, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 19</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 16</bibl>; Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 491, 7</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>fruor</etym>, <hi rend="ital">an enjoying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enjoyment.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18861.1" n="I" level="1"> In abstracto. </sense><sense id="n18861.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (perh. only ante- and post-class.): <hi rend="ital">Ol.</hi> Mea est haec. <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Scio; sed meus fructus est prior, i. e. <hi rend="ital">use and enjoyment</hi>, for ususfructus (q. v. under usus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:8:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 8, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18861.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (class. but rare): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc tam singulare vestrum beneficium ad animi mei fructum atque laetitiam duco esse permagnum,</quote> <trans><tr>for my mental enjoyment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: qui propter odium fructum oculis (<case>dat.</case>) ex ejus casu capere vellent, <hi rend="ital">to feast their eyes on</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 11</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spectatumne huc, ut rem fruendam oculis, sociorum caedes venimus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 14, 4</bibl></cit>).—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n18861.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., the enjoyment that proceeds from a thing, <hi rend="ital">proceeds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">product</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">income</hi> (very freq. and class.; in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>; cf.: fruges, fetus, frumentum). </sense><sense id="n18861.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: quod earum rerum videa <cb n="FRUG" /> tur ei levis fructus, exiguus usus, incertus dominatus, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pecudes partim esse ad usum hominum, partim ad fructum, partim ad vescendum procreatas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:8:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 8, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:37:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 37, 4</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also ususfructus, under usus: frugum fructuumque reliquorum perceptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructum ex aliqua re percipere or capere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam fructum arbitror esse fundi eum, qui ex eo satus nascitur utilis ad aliquam rem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:23:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruri si recte habitaveris, fructi plus capies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 4, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in quos sumptus abeunt fructus praediorum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praediorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbusta vineaeque et consita omnia magis amoenis quam necessariis fructibus,</quote> <trans><tr>fruits</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vacca) a bima aut trima fructum ferre incipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinarum fructus erant ova et pulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (oves) neque ali neque ullum fructum edere ex se sine cultu hominum possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non serendis, non percipiendis, non condendis fructibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 7, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ver ostendit futuros fructus: reliqua tempora demetendis fructibus et percipiendis accommodata sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comportare et condere fructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apibus fructum restituo suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 13, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fructibus arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructum ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graves fructu vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: Heracleotae et Bragyletae, qui item debent, aut pecuniam solvant aut fructibus suis satisfaciant, <hi rend="ital">satisfy him with their proceeds</hi>, Cic Fam. 13, 56, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">Asia multos annos vobis fructum Mithridatico bello non tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Agr. 2:30:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 30, 83</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 2:29:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 29, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Crassus negabat ullam satis magnam pecuniam esse ei ... cujus fructibus exercitum alere non posset,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>revenue</tr>, <tr>income</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Off. 1:8:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum ex fructu metallorum coacervatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 40, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tantas brevi creverant opes, seu maritimis seu terrestribus fructibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fuerat ei magno fructui mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 36, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua re saepe totius anni fructus uno rumore periculi amittitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an partus ancillae in fructu sit habendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:4:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">putatisne vos illis rebus frui posse nisi eos, qui vobis fructui (al. fructuosi) sunt, conservaveritis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 6, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18861.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fruit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consequence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">result</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">success</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego fructus ex re publica non laetos et uberes, sed magna acerbitate permixtos tuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:38:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 38, 92</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fructum pietatis suae ex aliquo ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:31:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 31, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex otio fructus capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex accusatione Aquilii diligentiae fructum ceperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:62:222" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 62, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus amoris et judicii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honeste acta superior aetas fructus auctoritatis capit ipsa extremos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 18, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modestiae fructum aliquem percipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria est fructus verae virtutis honestissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:24:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 24, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">2: studiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8 praef" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8 praef.</bibl></cit> § 26; 10, 3, 2; 10, 7, 1; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: ex re decerpere fructus (with plus mali haurire),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitiarum fructus in copia est,</quote> <trans><tr>the enjoyment derived from riches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:2:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestrum beneficium, ad animi mei fructum atque laetitiam permagnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Theophrastus talium sumptuum facultatem fructum divitiarum putat. Mihi autem ille fructus liberalitatis, multo et major videtur et certior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 16, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae fructus maximus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 18, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi fructus, qui in te videndo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae fructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 12, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:23:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 23, 47</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem fructum vitae superioris perdidissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:9:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin spe posteritatis fructuque ducatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 23, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jucunditatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:19:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 19, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graviore sono tibi Musa loquetur Nostra, dabunt cum maturos mihi tempora fructus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frugalis: <entryFree id="n18862" type="main" key="fru_ga_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frūgālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>frux</etym>. * <sense id="n18862.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to fruits</hi>: maturitas, App. de Mundo, p. 71, 29.—</sense><sense id="n18862.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to frugi, v. frux, II. B.) <hi rend="ital">Economical</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thrifty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temperate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frugal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">careful;</hi> and in gen., <hi rend="ital">worthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtuous;</hi> only in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 17</bibl>, characterizes the use of the positive frugalis for the usual frugi as pedantry): <cit><quote lang="la">villa frugalior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanton ... Lesbonicus factus est frugalior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedo patri me nunciam, ut frugalior sim, quam volt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; Sen. <cb n="FRUG" /> Contr. 3, 21, 20; 5, 31, 13 al.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum optimus colonus, parcissimus, modestissimus, frugalissimus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:71:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 71, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines frugalissimi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 29, 71</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">frūgālĭter</orth> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">moderately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temperately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thriftily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frugally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">economically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem sobrie et frugaliter accurare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere (with parce),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 107</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">recte is negat, umquam bene cenasse Gallonium ... quia quod bene, id recte, frugaliter, honeste: ille porro prave, nequiter, turpiter cenabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de sublimibus magnifice, de tenuioribus frugaliter dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Ep. ad Ver. 1" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Ep. ad Ver. 1</bibl></cit> Mai.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Ira D. 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frugalitas: <entryFree id="n18863" type="main" key="fru_ga_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frūgālĭtas</orth>, <itype>tātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>frugalis, II.</etym>, <sense id="n18863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">economy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temperance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thriftiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frugality;</hi> and in gen., <hi rend="ital">worth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtue</hi> (the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">swfrosu/nh</foreign>; class.). </sense><sense id="n18863.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes in illo sunt rege virtutes, sed praecipue singularis et admiranda frugalitas ... ego frugalitatem, id est modestiam et temperantiam, virtutem maximam judico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: vitae genus cum luxu aut cum frugalitate, Cels. praef. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex contrariis: frugalitas bonum, luxuria enim malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cessat ex reditu, frugalitate suppletur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona valetudo, quaeque eam maxime praestat frugalitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:19" default="NO">11, 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:8" default="NO">12, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frugalitas autem paupertas voluntaria est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 17:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 17, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxurioso frugalitas poena est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 71:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 71, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. An. 1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tranq. An. 1, 9</bibl>.—Of speech: <cit><quote lang="la">quadam eloquentiae frugalitate contentos,</quote> <trans><tr>measure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 21</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n18863.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in concr. for fruges, <hi rend="ital">fruits</hi> of the earth, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 233, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18863.3" n="II" level="1"> In a gen. sense, <hi rend="ital">worth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtue</hi>: temperans, quem Graeci <foreign lang="greek">sw/frona</foreign> appellant, eamque virtutem <foreign lang="greek">swfrosu/nhn</foreign> vocant, quam soleo equidem tum temperantiam, tum moderationem appellare, nonnumquam etiam modestiam: <cit><quote lang="la">sed haud scio an recte ea virtus frugalitas appellari possit, etc. ... reliquas etiam virtutes frugalitas continet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:8:16 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 8, 16 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 16, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:29" default="NO">29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
frugaliter: <entryFree id="n18864" type="main" key="fru_ga_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frūgālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. frugalis <sense id="n18864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
frugamenta: <entryFree id="n18865" type="gloss" key="fru_ga_menta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frūgāmenta</orth> <itype>a frugibus appellata</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=91" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 91</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
fruges: <entryFree id="n18866" type="main" key="fru_ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frūges</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, v. frux.</entryFree>
frugesco: <entryFree id="n18867" type="main" key="fru_gesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frūgesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n18867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [frux], <hi rend="ital">to bear fruit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be fruitful</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 913</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with florescere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frugi: <entryFree id="n18868" type="main" key="fru_gi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frūgi</orth>, v. frux, II. B.</entryFree>
frugifer: <entryFree id="n18869" type="main" key="fru_gi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frūgĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype> (archaic <sense id="n18869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing. fem.</hi> frugiferaï, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 7</bibl> P.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:90:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 90, 5</bibl>, and <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>frux + fero</etym>, <hi rend="ital">fruit-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fertile</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n18869.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut agri non omnes frugiferi sunt, qui coluntur, sic animi non omnes culti fructum ferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: terraï frugiferaï, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 7</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 479 Vahl.); <cit><quote lang="la">hence comically used to denote Ennius himself: attonitus legis Terraï frugiferaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:90:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 90, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatia frugifera et immensa camporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:64:161" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 64, 161</bibl></cit>: et ferta arva Asiae, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:49:163" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 49, 163</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 5, 11, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuces, Ov. de Nuce, 19: messes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:M. 5:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 656</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numen,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Ceres</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:P. 2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Frugifer,</quote> <trans><tr>an appellation of Osiris among the Egyptians</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 196</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18869.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profitable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tota philosophia frugifera et fructuosa nec ulla pars ejus inculta ac deserta sit, tum nullus feracior in ea locus nec uberior quam de officiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: hoc illud est praecipue in cognitione rerum salubre ac frugiferum, te, etc., Liv. praef. § 10.</sense></entryFree>
frugiferens: <entryFree id="n18870" type="hapax" key="fru_gi^fe^rens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frūgĭfĕrens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fruitbearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruitful</hi> (for the class. frugifer): <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frugilegus: <entryFree id="n18871" type="hapax" key="fru_gi^le^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frūgĭlĕgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>frux+lego</etym>, <sense id="n18871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fruit-gathering</hi>, a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of the ant: <cit><quote lang="la">formicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:624" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 624</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frugiparens: <entryFree id="n18872" type="hapax" key="fru_gi^pa^rens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frūgĭpărens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>frux+pario</etym>, <sense id="n18872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fruit-bearing</hi>, Venant. Carm. 3, 13, 12.</sense></entryFree>
frugiparus: <entryFree id="n18873" type="main" key="fru_gi^pa^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frūgĭpărus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fruitbearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruitful</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">ante- and postclass.): fetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus (temporum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 1054</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frugiperdus: <entryFree id="n18874" type="hapax" key="fru_gi^perdus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frūgĭperdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>frux + perdo</etym>, <sense id="n18874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fruit-losing</hi>, a transl. of the Homeric <pb n="785" /> <cb n="FRUM" /> <foreign lang="greek">w)lesi/karpos</foreign>, salix, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 26, 46, § 110</bibl> (cf. Hom. Odyss. 10, 510).</sense></entryFree>
fruitio: <entryFree id="n18875" type="main" key="frui^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fruĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fruor</etym>, <sense id="n18875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">enjoyment</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Philem. 1, 20 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
fruiturus: <entryFree id="n18876" type="main" key="frui^tu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fruĭtūrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. fruor.</entryFree>
frumen: <entryFree id="n18877" type="main" key="fru_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frūmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>fruor</etym> (post-class.). * <sense id="n18877.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A gruel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">porridge made of corn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and used in sacrifices</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 230</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18877.1" n="II" level="1"> = <foreign lang="greek">la/rugc</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the larynx</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throat</hi>, Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 74</bibl>, and A. 1, 178; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20, 2, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
frumentaceus: <entryFree id="n18878" type="main" key="fru_menta_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frūmentācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>frumentum</etym>, <sense id="n18878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of corn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corn</hi>- (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">farina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 37, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frumentalis: <entryFree id="n18879" type="main" key="fru_menta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frūmentālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, = frumentarius, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 34, 21</bibl>.</entryFree>
frumentarius: <entryFree id="n18880" type="main" key="fru_menta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frūmentārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to corn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corn-;</hi> milit., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to provisions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provision-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:11:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:7:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <trans><tr>corn</tr>, <tr>provisions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:5:section=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 5, § 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 23, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 37</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>abounding in corn</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">provinciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:73:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 73, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis,</quote> <trans><tr>a provision-ship</tr>, <tr>store-ship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:96:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 96, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <trans><tr>respecting the distribution of grain at low rates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:20:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 20, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:48:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 48, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:62:222" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 62, 222</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">magna largitio C. Gracchi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 21, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:5:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 5, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 37</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">85: negotiatores,</quote> <trans><tr>corn-dealers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 44, 69, § 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensores,</quote> <trans><tr>corn-measurers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:87" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 1, 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18880.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">frūmentāri-us</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n18880.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A corn-dealer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentarii, quibus cunctis montes maxumi frumenti sunt structi domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:13:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 13, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 16, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 12, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:15:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 15, 6 al.</bibl> In the time of the emperors employed as a secret spy, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 39" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Capitol. Max. et Balb. 10, 3.—</sense><sense id="n18880.3" n="B" level="2"> Milit., <hi rend="ital">a purveyor of corn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commissary of the stores</hi>, <hi rend="ital">victualler</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:35:4" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 35, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3491</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3515</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4922</bibl>; cf. frumentator.</sense></entryFree>
frumentatio: <entryFree id="n18881" type="main" key="fru_menta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frūmentātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>frumentor</etym>. <sense id="n18881.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A providing of corn</hi>, milit., <hi rend="ital">a foraging</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 39, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 20</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabulationes frumentationesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 16, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 64, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18881.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A distribution of corn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">42</bibl>; Monum. Ancyr.</sense></entryFree>
frumentator: <entryFree id="n18882" type="main" key="fru_menta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frūmentātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a provider of corn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purchaser of grain</hi>: in Volscis frumentum ne emi quidem potuit; <cit><quote lang="la">periculum ipsis frumentatoribus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 34, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18882.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a forager</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:36:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 36, 8</bibl>; ib. § 9 al.</sense></entryFree>
frumentor: <entryFree id="n18883" type="main" key="fru_mentor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frūmentor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n18883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [frumentum]. </sense><sense id="n18883.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, milit. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to fetch corn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to forage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purvey</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat eodem tempore et materiari et frumentari et tantas munitiones fieri necesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in propinquo agro frumentarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 36, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentatum mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 32, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 36, 2</bibl>: frumentatum ire, Pompei. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl>, C, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentandi rationem habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:75:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 75, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabulandi aut frumentandi causa progressi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:48:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 48, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentatum missus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 56:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 56, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18883.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to furnish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">provide with corn</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Natt. 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
frumentum: <entryFree id="n18884" type="main" key="fru_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frūmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>contr. from frugimentum, from FRVG, v. fruor; fruit, <foreign lang="greek">kat) e)coxh/n</foreign>, i. e.</etym>, <sense id="n18884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">corn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grain</hi> (class.; in <number>sing.</number> usually of corn harvested): <cit><quote lang="la">Julianus scribit: frumentum id esse, quod arista in se teneat, recte Gallum definisse: lupinum vero et fabam fruges potius dici, quia non arista sed siliqua continentur, quae Servius apud Alfenum in frumento contineri putat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:77" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 77</bibl></cit>: sunt prima earum (frugum) genera: frumenta, ut triticum, hordeum; <cit><quote lang="la">et legumina, ut faba, cicer,</quote> <trans><tr>kinds of corn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 9, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in segetibus frumentum, in quo culmus extulit spicam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:48:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 48, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triticum vel alia frumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:9:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triticeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galli turpe esse ducunt frumentum manu quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum ex agris in loca tuta comportatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in itinere copia frumenti suppeteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 48, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens frumenti acervus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:48" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:12" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 12</bibl>; 23, 21 et saep.: tessera frumenti,<cb n="FRUO" />  <hi rend="ital">a ticket giving the holder a share in the public distribution of corn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:174" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 174</bibl>; cf. Dict. of Antiq. pp. 580 sq., 864.—In <number>plur.</number> (esp. of standing grain: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta sunt proprie omnia quae aristas habent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 3</bibl></cit>): bona, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:17:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuriosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:24:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 24, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo frumenta in agris matura non erant, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 40, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 9, 8</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta autumni matura in agris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:67:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 67, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 72</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:15" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 2</bibl>; 33, 6 et saep.— </sense><sense id="n18884.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: frumenta, <hi rend="ital">the small seeds</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grains of figs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 19, 21, § 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:256" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 27, 44, § 256</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
frundifer: <entryFree id="n18885" type="main" key="frundi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frundĭfer</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">frundōsus</orth>, v. frond-.</entryFree>
fruniscor: <entryFree id="n18886" type="main" key="fru_niscor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frūniscor</orth>, <itype>frūnītus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n18886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [a lengthened form of fruor], <hi rend="ital">to enjoy</hi> (anteand post-class.); constr. with <hi rend="ital">acc.;</hi> rarely with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Q. Claudius Quadrigiarius) Domus, inquit, suas quemque ire jubet et sua omnia frunisci ... ut fatiscor a fateor, ita fruniscor factum est a fruor. Q. Metellus Numidicus ... ita scripsit: Ego neque aqua neque igni careo, et summa gloria fruniscor. Novius in Atellana, quae Parcus inscripta, hoc verbo ita utitur: Quod magno opere quaesiverunt, id frunisci non queunt. Qui non parsit apud se, frunitus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:5 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 5 sq.</bibl></cit>: Fruniscor et frunitum dixit Cato: nosque cum adhuc dicimus infrunitum, certum est antiquos dixisse frunitum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=92" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 92</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Frunisci pro frui. Lucilius: Aeque fruniscor ego ac tu. Coelius (leg. Claudius) ... Novius ... (then follow the passages quoted above from Gellius),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 113, 7 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc tu nisi malum, frunisci nil potes, ne postules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">QVEM NON LIQVIT (i. e. licuit) NOS FRVNISCI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4768</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frunitus: <entryFree id="n18887" type="main" key="fru_ni_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frūnītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from fruniscor.</entryFree>
fruns: <entryFree id="n18888" type="main" key="fruns"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fruns</orth>, <itype>fruntis</itype>, v. 1. frons <sense id="n18888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fruor: <entryFree id="n18889" type="main" key="fru^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frŭor</orth>, <itype>fructus</itype> (<sense id="n18889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> fruitus est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:4:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 4, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fruiti sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 93:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 93, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:104:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 104, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:940" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 940</bibl>; v. Neue, Formenl. 2, 562; <hi rend="ital">part. fut.</hi> fruiturus, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>; <hi rend="ital">imp.</hi> FRVIMINO, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3121</bibl>; as famino from fari, see below, II.), 3, <hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [for frugvor, from the root FRVG, of fruges, fructus; Goth. bruk-jan; Germ. brauchen, to use], <hi rend="ital">to derive enjoyment from</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to enjoy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delight in</hi> (with a more restricted signif. than uti, to make use of a thing, to use it; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibal cum victoria posset uti, frui maluit, relictaque Roma Campaniam peragrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:21" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu voluptate frueris, ego utor: tu illam summum bonum putas, ego nec bonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">id est cujusque proprium quo quisque fruitur atque utitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 30, 2</bibl></cit>). Constr. with <case>abl.</case>; less freq. with <case>acc.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18889.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n18889.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utatur suis bonis oportet et fruatur, qui beatus futurus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:37:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 37, 103</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimis maritimis rebus fruimur atque utimur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 60, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commoda, quibus utimur, lucemque, qua fruimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:45:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 45, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aevo sempiterno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">immortali aevo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:61:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 61, 170</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 61:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 61, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus in vita commodis una cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 24, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meo amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:48" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 48</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">thalamis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:554" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 554</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam his, quae nec cibo nec poculo sunt, frui dicimur, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Donat.</author> ad Ter. Eun. 4, 7, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recordatione nostrae amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usu alicujus et moribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">securitate (animus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timore paventum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:566" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 566</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">poenă,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:30:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (genus vitae), virtute fruitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 6, 15</bibl></cit> Madv. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo (spectaculo) fructus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:104:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 104, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum cognitione fructi sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 93" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 93 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non meo nomine, sed suo fructus est emptor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:4:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 759</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum esse beatum, qui praesentibus voluptatibus frueretur confideretque se fruiturum aut in omni aut in magna parte vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:17:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 17, 38</bibl></cit>.—Of personal objects, <hi rend="ital">to enjoy one's society</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque te fruimur et tu nobis cares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Attico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sinat Sese alternas cum illo noctes hac frui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cara conjuge,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:3:32" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:24" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18889.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabulum frui occipito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 149, 1</bibl></cit>: ea, <cb n="FRUS" /> quae fructus cumque es, periere profusa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:940" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 940</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">meo modo ingenium frui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 21</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">part. fut. pass.</hi> (only so in class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">permittitur infinita potestas innumerabilis pecuniae conficiendae de vestris vectigalibus, non fruendis sed alienandis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 13, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis haec fruenda relinqueret, quae ipse servasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:23:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 23, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus (voluptatis) fruendae modus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 30, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitiae fruendae causa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agro bene culto nihil potest esse nec usu uberius nec specie ornatius: ad quem fruendum non modo non retardat, verum etiam invitat senectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 16, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (florem aetatis) patri Hannibalis fruendum praebuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res fruenda oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 14, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18889.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">satiatis et expletis jucundius est carere quam frui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 14, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">datur: fruare, dum licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae gignuntur nobis ad fruendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:7:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 7, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">di tibi divitias dederant artemque fruendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fruebamur, cum, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>were delighted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:34:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 34, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18889.5" n="II" level="1"> In partic., jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to have the use and enjoyment of</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to have the usufruct</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid? si constat, hunc non modo colendis praediis praefuisse, sed certis fundis patre vivo frui solitum esse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">EVM AGRVM POSIDERE FRVIQVE VIDETVR OPORTERE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3121</bibl></cit> (A. U. C. 637); cf.: AGRVM POSIDEBVNT FRVENTVRQVE, ib.: AGRVM NEI HABETO NIVE FRVIMINO, ib.; and: <cit><quote lang="la">QVOD ANTE K. IAN. FRVCTI SVNT ERVNTQVE VECTIGAL, ib.: ut censores agrum Campanum fruendum locarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 11, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in perpetuum fundum fruendum conduxerunt a municipibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:3:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 6, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
frus: <entryFree id="n18890" type="main" key="frus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frus</orth>, v. 1. frons.</entryFree>
frusino: <entryFree id="n18891" type="main" key="Fru^si^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Frŭsĭno</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of the Hernici</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">situated on the Via Latina</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Frosinone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:224" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 224</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n18891.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Frŭsĭnas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Frusino</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundus,</quote> <trans><tr>in the neighborhood of Frusino</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 13, 4</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Frŭsĭnātes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Frusino</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
frustatim: <entryFree id="n18892" type="main" key="frusta_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frustātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>frustum</etym>, <sense id="n18892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">piecemeal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in pieces</hi> (very rare): objectare leonibus prandium, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 113, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coquitur in olla, aut frustatim in patinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 39, § 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 720</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
frustillatim: <entryFree id="n18893" type="main" key="frustilla_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frustillātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>frustillum</etym>, <sense id="n18893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in small pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in little bits</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nisi mihi virgo redditur, Jam ego te faciam ut hic formicae frustillatim differant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 20</bibl></cit>; Poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 112, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
frustillum: <entryFree id="n18894" type="main" key="frustillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frustillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>frustum</etym>, <sense id="n18894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small piece</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little bit</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">parvula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 84</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frusto: <entryFree id="n18895" type="hapax" key="frusto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frusto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n18895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to break to pieces</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Punicae praedae omnibus promontoriis insulisque frustarentur et fluitarent, etc.,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the booty taken from the Carthaginians went to wreck and was driven in pieces on the promontories</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2:32" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 2, 32</bibl></cit> (so acc. to the conjecture of Salmasius, Graevius, and others, instead of the common and certainly false reading, frustrarentur. N. Heinsius proposes eructarentur; v. eructo, II.).</sense></entryFree>
frustra: <entryFree id="n18896" type="main" key="frustra_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frustrā</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-tră</orth>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 1, 13), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>orig. <hi rend="ital">acc. plur. neutr.</hi>, afterwards <hi rend="ital">abl. sing. fem.</hi> of frusterus, for frud-; v. fraus; hence</etym>. <sense id="n18896.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">In deception, in error</hi> (so mostly anteclass. and in historians; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. and Caes.): ambo, et servus et era, frustra sunt duo, Qui me Amphitruonem rentur esse: errant probe,</quote> <trans><tr>are deceived</tr>, <tr>in error</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 3, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc, mulier, nei frustra sies, mea non es: ne arbitrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo mihi acrius annitendum est, ut neque vos capiamini, et illi frustra sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frustra esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 74</bibl></cit>: hilarus est; <cit><quote lang="la">frustrast homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 40</bibl></cit> Lorenz: <cit><quote lang="la">ne frustra sis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:3:18 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 3, 18 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:29 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5, 29 al.</bibl>; cf. in the foll. II. A.—With <hi rend="ital">animi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erras, Aemiliane, et longe hujus animi frustra es,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 286</bibl></cit>.—Frustra habere aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to deceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheat one</hi> (= eludere): <cit><quote lang="la">Corbulo quaesito diu proelio frustra habitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Persae frustra habitae redissent ad sua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: servom ac dominum, Plaut. Am. argument. 5.— <pb n="786" /> <cb n="FRUS" /> </sense><sense id="n18896.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, according as particular respect is had to the effect, the aim, or the reason of an action, <hi rend="ital">without effect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to no purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uselessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in vain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for nothing</hi> (freq. and class.; the predom. signif. in prose and poetry; cf.: in cassum, nequiquam). </sense><sense id="n18896.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Without effect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in vain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii parasiti frustra obambulabant in foro, i. e. they got no dinner,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesagibat mihi animus, frustra me ire, quom exibam domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: nemo dabit; <cit><quote lang="la">frustra egomet mecum has rationes puto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frustra operam opinor sumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ipse auxilium suum saepe a viris bonis frustra implorari patietur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:33:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 33, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec si verbis explicare conemur, frustra suscipiatur labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortissima frustra pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 348</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 389</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum frustraque rogatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 735</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peritura frustra agmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:736" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 736</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 140</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frustra telum mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 25, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frustra tantum laborem sumere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus neque consilium neque inceptum ullum frustra erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 7, 6</bibl></cit> Kritz.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 14, 11</bibl> Dietsch; 61, 1; 71, 5; 73 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> al.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ita frustra id inceptum Volscis fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque frustrabor ultra cives meos, neque ipse frustra dictator ero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:31:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 31, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frustra cruento Marte carebimus, frustra metuemus Austrum: Visendus ater Cocytus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 13</bibl></cit> and 15: <cit><quote lang="la">nam frustra vitium vitaveris illud, si te alio pravum detorseris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam frustra (expressere) quam recusaverat (= aeque frustra fuit et sine eventu),</quote> <trans><tr>likewise without effect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 90 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (see the passage in conn.).—With <hi rend="ital">nequiquam</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:77:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 77, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 208, 40</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">sic</hi>: ego astabo hic tantisper cum hac forma et factis sic frustra; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ou(/tws a)/llws</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 30</bibl>.—In a pun with frustra esse (v. supra, I.) and frustrari: qui lepide postulat alterum frustrari, quom frustra'st, frustra illum dicit frustra esse. Nam qui se frustrari quem frustra sentit, Qui frustratur, frustra'st, si ille non est frustra, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:2:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 2, 7</bibl> (Sat. 33, p. 158 sq. Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n18896.3" n="2" level="3"> Ellipt.: <cit><quote lang="la">equites et auxiliarios pedites in omnes partes mittit ... Nec frustra. Nam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:5:3" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">frustra: nam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:11:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 11, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18896.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Without reason</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">groundlessly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frustra ac sine causa quid facere indignum deo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:60:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 60, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frustra tempus contero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae disputatio ne frustra haberetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (res) prima impulit etiam, ut suspiceremus in caelum nec frustra siderum motus intueremur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; 4, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:10:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 10, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:12:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 12, 36</bibl>; v. Madv. ad h. l. p. 210: non igitur frustra Plato civili viro, quem <foreign lang="greek">politiko/n</foreign> vocant, necessariam musicen credidit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:56" default="NO">10, 1, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut multi, nec frustra, opinantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid inexpertum frustra moritura relinquat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 415</bibl></cit> Forbig. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n18896.5" n="2" level="3"> Ellipt.: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc quidam aposiopesin putant. Frustra. Nam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frustrabilis: <entryFree id="n18897" type="main" key="frustra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frustrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>frustror</etym>, <sense id="n18897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that will be disappointed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceitful</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">exspectatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 206</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frustramen: <entryFree id="n18898" type="hapax" key="frustra_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frustrāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deception</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos in fraudem induimus frustraminis ipsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:817" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 817</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frustratio: <entryFree id="n18899" type="main" key="frustra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frustrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deceiving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deception</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disappointment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frustration</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not used by Cicero): in horunc familiam Hodie frustrationem iniciam maximam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">frustrationes dare (with ludificare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamant, fraude fieri, quod foris teneatur exercitus: frustrationem eam legis tollendae esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum longo sermone habito dilatus per frustationem esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 25, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">subj. gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frustratio Gallorum eo spectabat, ut tererent tempus, donec, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 25, 7</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum variis frustrationibus differretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 6</bibl></cit>: quo magis me petiverunt, tanto majorem iis frustratio dolorem attulit, <hi rend="ital">failure</hi>, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 23, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 20, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine successu ac bono eventu frustratio est, non cultura,</quote> <trans><tr>failure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18899.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A delaying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keeping back</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:37 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 37 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
frustrator: <entryFree id="n18900" type="main" key="frustra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frustrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deceiver; delayer</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">judicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 10:44" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 10, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:16:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 16, 19</bibl>. <cb n="FRUT" /></sense></entryFree>
frustratorius: <entryFree id="n18901" type="main" key="frustra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frustrātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>frustrator</etym>, <sense id="n18901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deceptive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceitful</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">somnia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appellatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:1:41" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 1, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frustratus: <entryFree id="n18902" type="hapax" key="frustra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frustrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>frustror</etym>, <sense id="n18902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deceiving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deception</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliam invenito, quam habeas frustratui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 3, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frustro: <entryFree id="n18903" type="main" key="frustro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frustro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n18903.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
frustror: <entryFree id="n18904" type="main" key="frustror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frustror</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n18904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep.;</hi> also: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fru-stro</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>frustra</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to deceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disappoint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frustrate</hi> (syn.: decipio, deludo, fraudo, fallo, etc.). </sense><sense id="n18904.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.). </sense><sense id="n18904.2" n="(a)" level="5"> In the <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> form: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quis praestigiator hanc frustratur mulierem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut certare cum aliis pugnaciter aut frustrari cum alios, tum etiam me ipsum velim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 20, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne frustretur ipse se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ipsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: o bone, ne te Frustrere; <cit><quote lang="la">insanis et tu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarquinios spe auxilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cloelia frustrata custodes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe jam me spes frustrata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 37</bibl></cit>; Lentul. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 14, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sat adhuc tua nos frustrata est fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectationem frustrari et differre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">improbas spes hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 8:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem mercantium (opp. explere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frustratus vincula,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>escaped from them</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">o numquam frustrata vocatus hasta meos,</quote> <trans><tr>hast never deceived me invoking thee</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 95</bibl></cit>;
