cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:62" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 62</bibl>: inceptus clamor frustratur hiantes, <hi rend="ital">deceives</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">dies away from their lips</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 493</bibl>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cocceius vide ne frustretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 18, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 571</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18904.3" n="(b)" level="5"> In the <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> form: <cit><quote lang="la">non frustrabo vos, milites, Caes. Fragm. ap. Diomed. p. 395 P.: atque i se quom frustrant, frustrari alios stolidi existumant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:38:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 38, 9</bibl>; cf.: qui ventrem frustrarunt suum, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 473, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frustrantia dona,</quote> <trans><tr>fruitless</tr>, <tr>bootless</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 640</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: frustramur, irridemur, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 793</bibl> P.: ignavissimi quique tenuissima spe frustrantur, Sall. Or. Licin. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">frustratus spe continuandi consulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:21:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 21, 2</bibl></cit>; for which: frustratus a spe, Fenest. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 793</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">variis dilationibus frustratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">captionis versutae et excogitatae frustratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:10:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 10, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18904.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make vain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of no effect</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">useless</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">imprudenter facta opera frustrantur impensas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">laborem, id. praef. § 22: in se implicati arborum rami lento vimine frustrabantur ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frustulentus: <entryFree id="n18905" type="hapax" key="frustu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frustŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>frustum</etym>, <sense id="n18905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of small pieces</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>filled with crumbs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frustulum: <entryFree id="n18906" type="main" key="frustu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frustŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small piece</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little bit</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">frustulum panis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 110, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frustum: <entryFree id="n18907" type="main" key="frustum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frustum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n18907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a piece</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bit</hi> (syn.: fragmentum, segmentum). </sense><sense id="n18907.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of food (class.): frusto panis conduci potest, vel uti taceat, vel uti loquatur, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">necesse est, offa objecta cadere frustum ex pulli ore cum pascitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:15:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 15, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esculenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (also ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 44</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">viscera pars in frusta secant, verubusque trementia figunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lardi semesa frusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt qui frustis et pomis viduas venentur avaras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capreae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:142" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudum et frusta rogantem,</quote> <trans><tr>scraps</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:210" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solidae frusta farinae,</quote> <trans><tr>lumps</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 68</bibl></cit>; cf. 14, 128.—</sense><sense id="n18907.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a piece</hi> as a small part of a whole (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): unde soluta fere oratio, et e singulis non membris sed frustis collata, structura caret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 27</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so (opp. membra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophiam in partes, non in frusta dividam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 89" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frusta pannorum,</quote> <trans><tr>rags</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—Comically: <cit><quote lang="la">frustum pueri,</quote> <trans><tr>you bit of a boy!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 68</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frutectosus: <entryFree id="n18908" type="main" key="fru^tecto_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frŭtectōsus</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">frutētosus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>frutectum</etym>, <sense id="n18908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of bushes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shrubs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrubby</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bushy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bosky</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemorosi frutectosique tractus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">smilax spinosis frutectosa ramis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 35, 63, § 153</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:179" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 37, 71, § 179</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
frutectum: <entryFree id="n18909" type="main" key="fru^tectum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frŭtectum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">frutētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>contr. from fruticetum</etym>, <sense id="n18909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place full of shrubs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bushes.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18909.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager frutectis aut arboribus obsessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: rosa silvestris in <cb n="FRUX" /> frutecto, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 2, 6, § 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebrosa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 872</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acuta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Psych. 443</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:11:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 11, 16</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n18909.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a shrub</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id frutectum (sc. cinnamum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 30, § 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frutetum: <entryFree id="n18910" type="main" key="fru^te_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frŭtētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <sense id="n18910.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the preced.</ref></xr> art. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
frutex: <entryFree id="n18911" type="main" key="fru^tex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frŭtex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n18911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilotica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 225</bibl></cit>) [prob. kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">bru/w</foreign>, to sprout forth], <hi rend="ital">a shrub</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bush</hi> (cf. arbor). </sense><sense id="n18911.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: ex surculo vel arbor procedit, ut olea, ficus, pirus; vel frutex, ut violae, rosae, arundines; <cit><quote lang="la">vel tertium quiddam, quod neque arborem neque fruticem proprie dixerimus, sicuti est vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 64, § 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 249</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 135</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 24, 55, § 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:63" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:14:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus fruticis recentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 3, 35, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frutices inter membra condebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:956" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 956</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his genus omne silvarum fruticumque viret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in montuosis locis et fruticibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; collect. in the <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">venari asello comite cum vellet leo, Contexit illum frutice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 11, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18911.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18911.3" n="A" level="2"> Perh., <hi rend="ital">the lower part of the stem of a tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the trunk</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus antiqua singulos repente ramos a frutice dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl></cit> (al. radice).—</sense><sense id="n18911.4" n="B" level="2"> As a term of reproach, like caudex, stipes, <hi rend="ital">blockhead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec veri simile loquere nec verum, frutex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit> Lorenz (Ritschl, rupex); <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 317</bibl>; v. Oud. ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
fruti: <entryFree id="n18912" type="main" key="Fru_ti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Frūti</orth>, v. Frutis.</entryFree>
fruticatio: <entryFree id="n18913" type="main" key="fru^ti^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frŭtĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fruticor</etym>, <sense id="n18913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a springing forth of shoots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sprouting out</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">inutilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 1, 1, § 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fruticesco: <entryFree id="n18914" type="main" key="fru^ti^cesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frŭtĭcesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n18914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [frutex], <hi rend="ital">to put forth shoots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sprout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become bushy</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quia (hae arbores) celeriter fruticescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 27, 45, § 257</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fruticetum: <entryFree id="n18915" type="main" key="fru^ti^ce_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frŭtĭcētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place full of shrubs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bushes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a thicket</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covert</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:12:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 12, 12</bibl> (10); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48</bibl>; cf. frutectum and fructeta.</sense></entryFree>
frutico: <entryFree id="n18916" type="main" key="fru^ti^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frŭtĭco</orth> (ū long in frūtĭcăt arbor, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Judic. Dom. 135</bibl>), <itype>āvi, ātum</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">frŭtĭcor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n18916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to put forth shoots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sprout out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become bushy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18916.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">excisa est arbor, non evulsa: itaque, quam fruticetur, vides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi ex uno semine pluribus culmis fruticavit (triticum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 41, § 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:92" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 5, 29, § 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:70" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 10, 14, § 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:205" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 205</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18916.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., of the hair: <cit><quote lang="la">fruticante pilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:15" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 15</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a stag's antlers: aspicis, ut fruticat late caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:6:37" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 6, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fruticosus: <entryFree id="n18917" type="main" key="fru^ti^co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frŭtĭcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of shrubs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bushes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrubby</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bushy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vimina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 344</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aizoum) a radice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 102, § 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor (terebinthus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 6, 12, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rutae rami fruticosiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 13, 51, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamus fruticosissimus qui vocatur donax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 22, 24, § 87</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frutinal: <entryFree id="n18918" type="main" key="Frutinal"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Frutinal</orth>, <sense id="n18918.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
frutis: <entryFree id="n18919" type="main" key="Fru_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Frūtis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (Etrusc. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fruti</orth>; <sense id="n18919.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>an Etruscan modification of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*)afrodi/th</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">an Etruscan name of Venus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veneri matri, quae Frutis dicitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—Hence: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Frutinal</orth>, <itype>ālis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: templum Veneris Fruti, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=90" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 90</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
frux: <entryFree id="n18920" type="main" key="frux"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frux</orth>, <itype>frūgis</itype>, and more freq. in <number>plur.</number> <orth extent="full" lang="la">frūges</orth>, <itype>um</itype> (also in <sense id="n18920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">frugis</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">frugi rectus est natura frux, at secundum consuetudinem dicimus, ut haec avis, haec ovis, sic haec frugis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=76" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 76</bibl></cit> dub.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>from the root FRUG; v. fruor</etym>, <hi rend="ital">fruits of the earth</hi> (that may be enjoyed), <hi rend="ital">produce of the fields</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pulse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">legumes</hi> (whereas fructus denotes chiefly tree-fruit, and frumentum halm-fruit, grain), sometimes also, in gen., for <hi rend="ital">fruits</hi> (grain, tree-fruit, etc.). </sense><sense id="n18920.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18920.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra feta frugibus et vario leguminum genere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:62:156" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 62, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fruges terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:51:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 51, 116</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 2, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nos fruges serimus, nos arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:152" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubertas frugum et fructuum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 36, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frugum fructuumque reliquorum perceptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleam frugesve ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque foliis, neque oleo neque frumento neque frugibus usurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:8:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 8, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:77" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 16, 77</bibl>: arbores frondescere ... segetes largiri fruges, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 69</bibl> (Trag. v. 195 Vahl.): ut cum fruges<pb n="787" /> <cb n="FRUX" />  Cererem appellamus, vinum autem Liberum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 60</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 656</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inventis frugibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 9, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fruges in ea terra (Sicilia) primum repertas esse arbitrantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48:section=106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultus agrorum perceptioque frugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: lentiscus triplici solita grandescere fetu, Ter fruges fundens, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 9, 15: arboreae, Cornif. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">roburneae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:1:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Gallorum gens) dulcedine frugum maximeque vini capta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:33:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 33, 2 al.</bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">salsae fruges = mola salsa,</quote> <trans><tr>the sacrificial roasted barley-meal mixed with salt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 133</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 173</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicatae,</quote> <trans><tr>magic herbs</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 420</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18920.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: si jam data sit frux, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 724</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 412 Vahl.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> v. 318</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">spicea frux, Aus. Monos. de Cibis, 4: (mensae) exstructae dapibus nec tostae frugis egentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non omnem frugem neque arborem in omni agro reperire possis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 27, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundit frugem spici ordine structam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus et ilex multa fruge pecus juvet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit bona librorum et provisae frugis in annum Copia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 109</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n18920.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18920.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., like fructus, <hi rend="ital">result</hi>, <hi rend="ital">success</hi>, <hi rend="ital">value</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae virtutis maturitas et quantae fruges industriae sint futurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:31:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 31, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illae sunt animi fruges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Aetn.</author> 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">generare atque ad frugem aliquam perducere,</quote> <trans><tr>to some maturity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illud ingeniorum velut praecox genus non temere umquam pervenit ad frugem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam ego et ipsa frugem tuam periclitabor,</quote> <trans><tr>maturity of mind</tr>, <tr>ability</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 177, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem nihili, neque rei neque frugis bonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:11:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. B. 1. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign> infra. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: centuriae seniorum agitant expertia frugis, <hi rend="ital">rail at what is crude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthless</hi> (= poëmata nimis jocosa), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 341</bibl>: cultor enim juvenum purgatas inseris aures Fruge Cleanthea, <hi rend="ital">with Cleanthian fruit</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">doctrine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:64" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">herus si tuus volet facere frugem, meum herum perdet,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to act with advantage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18920.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of moral character. </sense><sense id="n18920.7" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">frugi</orth> (a <case>dat.</case> form, fit for food; frugi aptus, serviceable, <foreign lang="greek">xrh/simos, xrhsto/s</foreign>; hence, transf.), as <hi rend="ital">adj. indecl.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">useful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discreet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temperate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frugal</hi> (class.; for <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> the words frugalior and frugalissimus were used; <cit><quote lang="la">v. frugalis): frugi hominem dici non multum habet laudis in rege,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 9, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:8:16 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 8, 16 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (L. Piso) tanta virtute atque integritate fuit, ut ... solus Frugi nominaretur. Quem cum in contionem Gracchus vocari juberet et viator quaereret, quem Pisonem, quod erant plures: Cogis me, inquit, dicere inimicum meum frugi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 13, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">loquitur ut Frugi ille Piso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:28:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 28, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines plane frugi ac sobrii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:27:section=67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 27, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego praeter alios meum virum fui rata Siccum, frugi, continentem (opp. madidum, nihili, incontinentem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominis frugi et temperantis functus officium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcius hic vivit: frugi dicatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antonius frugi factus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:28:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 28, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Penelope) tam frugi tamque pudica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sum bonus et frugi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo sane populus numerabilis, utpote parvus, Et frugi castusque verecundusque coibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus frugi atque integer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Davus, amicum mancipium domino et frugi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberti probi et frugi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:88:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 88, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (lena) frugi esse vult,</quote> <trans><tr>useful</tr>, <tr>serviceable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 59</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18920.8" n="(b)" level="5"> Strengthened by the attributive bonae: <cit><quote lang="la">is probus est, quem paenitet, quam probus sit et frugi bonae: Qui ipsus sibi satis placet, nec probus est nec frugi bonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 39</bibl></cit> and 40; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Fabius Luscus) satis acutus et permodestus ac bonae frugi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18920.9" n="b" level="4"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: frugi severaque vita, <hi rend="ital">honest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtuous</hi>, Cic. Fil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 21, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">victus luxuriosus, an frugi, an sordidus, quaeritur,</quote> <trans><tr>frugal</tr>, <tr>temperate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">atrium frugi nec tamen sordidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:167" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 167</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jentacula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:31:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 31, 1</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n18920.10" n="2" level="3"> Frux = homo frugi, <hi rend="ital">worthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honest</hi>: dictum factumque facit frux, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 724</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 318 Vahl.). <cb n="FUCU" /> —</sense><sense id="n18920.11" n="3" level="3"> Ad frugem or ad bonam frugem, in vulg. lang. (to turn or bring one's self) <hi rend="ital">to moral worth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtue</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem multos vidi et in hac civitate, qui totam adolescentiam voluptatibus dedissent, emersisse aliquando et se ad frugem bonam, ut dicitur, recepisse gravesque homines atque illustres fuisse,</quote> <trans><tr>have reformed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa ad bonam frugem ducentia in eo libro scripta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:27:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin tu adolescentem, quem esse corruptum vides, restituis? quin ad frugem corrigis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 81</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 10, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum'st ad frugem applicare animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fu: <entryFree id="n18921" type="main" key="fu"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fu</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, v. fue.</entryFree>
fuat: <entryFree id="n18922" type="main" key="fuat"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fuat</orth>, v. 1. sum <sense id="n18922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fucate: <entryFree id="n18923" type="main" key="fu_ca_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūcātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. fuco, <sense id="n18923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fucatus: <entryFree id="n18924" type="main" key="fu_ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from fuco.</entryFree>
fucilis: <entryFree id="n18925" type="gloss" key="fu_ci^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūcĭlis</orth> falsa: dicta autem quasi fucata, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=92" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 92</bibl> Müll. <sense id="n18925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fucinus: <entryFree id="n18926" type="hapax" key="fu_ci^nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūcĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. fucus</etym>, <sense id="n18926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">colored with orchil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si adhibeas fucinis sulphura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:76" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 76</bibl></cit> Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18927" type="main" key="Fu_ci^nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fūcĭnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lake of Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the territory of the Marsi</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lago Fucino</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Lago di Celano</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:759" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 759</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:de Spect. 28:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> de Spect. 28, 11</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">more freq. called Lacus Fucinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:57:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 57, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:124" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 15, 24, § 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:20 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 20 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fuco: <entryFree id="n18928" type="main" key="fu_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. fucus</etym>, <sense id="n18928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dye.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18928.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Alba nec Assyrio fucatur lana veneno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 465</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vellera Milesia saturo hyali colore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 334</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulas colore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinnas vario veneno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyneg. 309</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frena spumis sanguineis (equus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 3, 350</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humida creta colorque Stercore fucatus crocodili,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>paint made of crocodile's dung</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:11" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 11</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 28, § 109</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n18928.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., with cosmetics, <hi rend="ital">to paint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rouge.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18928.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fucandi cura coloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:487" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 487</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora vulsa atque fucata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8 praef.</bibl></cit> § 19.—</sense><sense id="n18928.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">unumquodque genus (dicendi) cum fucatur atque praelinitur, fit praestigiosum,</quote> <trans><tr>is embellished too much</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:14:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 14, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fūcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to II. B.), <hi rend="ital">painted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beautified</hi>, <hi rend="ital">falsified</hi>, <hi rend="ital">counterfeit</hi> (a favorite word of Cic.; syn.: simulatus; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. sincerus, verus, naturalis): secerni blandus amicus a vero et internosci tam potest adhibita diligentia quam omnia fucata et simulata a sinceris atque veris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 25, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturalis non fucatus nitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:9:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 9, 36</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fucati medicamenta candoris et ruboris omnia repellentur: elegantia modo et munditia remanebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:23:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 23, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa probitatis non fucata forensi specie, sed domesticis inusta notis veritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iisdem ineptiis fucata sunt illa omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer subdolae ac fucatae vernilitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 79</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus Homeri fucatior (opp. simplicior et sincerior),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:26:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 26, 3</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fūcāte</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with paint</hi> or <hi rend="ital">color</hi>: fucatius concinnata carmina, Aus. in prosa post Idyll. 3.</sense></entryFree>
fucosus: <entryFree id="n18929" type="main" key="fu_co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">painted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beautified</hi>, <hi rend="ital">counterfeit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spurious</hi> (Ciceron.): <cit><quote lang="la">visae merces, fallaces quidem et fucosae, chartis et linteis et vitro delatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicinitas non assueta mendaciis, non fucosa, non fallax, non erudita artificio simulationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitiosae fucosaeque amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 18, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n18929.1" n="1" level="3"> † <orth extent="full" lang="la">fūcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fu=kos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">rock-lichen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orchil</hi>, used as a red dye for woollen goods, Lichen roccella, Linn., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:103 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 10, 66, § 103 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut lana tincta fuco citra purpuras placet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 75</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18929.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">red</hi> or <hi rend="ital">purple color.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18929.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">infici vestes scimus admirabili fuco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 2, 3, § 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 27</bibl> Orell. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:222 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 222 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n18929.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n18929.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Rouge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paint for the complexion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetulae, quae vitia corporis fuco occulunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si caeruleo quaedam sua tempora fuco tinxerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:18:31" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 18, 31</bibl></cit> (3, 11, 10 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">mangones colorem fuco, et rerum robur inani sagina mentiantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18929.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Dross</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alloy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adulteration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulteratur (sal) rubrica aut testa trita, qui fucus aqua deprehenditur diluente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 42, § 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18929.7" n="3" level="3"> For propolis (q. v.), <hi rend="ital">the reddish<cb n="FUGA" />  juice with which bees stop up the entrances to their hive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bee-glue</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 39</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n18929.8" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">pretence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disguise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissimulation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">his tribus figuris insidere quidam venustatis non fuco illitus, sed sanguine diffusus debet color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:52:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 52, 199</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae tam verae, tam novae, tam sine pigmentis fucoque puerili,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 45, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuco ementitus color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in oratoris aut in poëtae cincinnis ac fuco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercem sine fucis gestat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sycophantiis nec fucis ullum mantellum obviam est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine fuco ac fallaciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: deum sese in hominem convertisse ... fucum factum mulieri, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to deceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impose upon</hi> (vulg.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si eum, qui tibi promiserit, audieris fucum, ut dicitur, facere velle aut senseris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 9:35" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 9, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fucus: <entryFree id="n18930" type="main" key="fu_cus" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 244</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 435</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fue: <entryFree id="n18931" type="main" key="fue"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fue</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">fu</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">fūfae</orth>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 213</bibl> P.), <pos>interj.</pos>, denoting aversion, <sense id="n18931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">foh! fie!</hi> fu! <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fufidius: <entryFree id="n18932" type="main" key="Fu_fi^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fūfĭdĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n18932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. So, Fufidius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 35, 86</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">another of the same name,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Fufidius,</quote> <trans><tr>an orator</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:30:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 30, 113</bibl></cit>; cf. Ruhnk. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:16:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 16, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Fufidius,</quote> <trans><tr>a knight</tr>, <tr>of Arpinum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fufidius,</quote> <trans><tr>a wealthy usurer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18932.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fūfĭdĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Fufidius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Fufidian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 14, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 15, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coheredes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 13, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fufius: <entryFree id="n18933" type="main" key="Fu_fi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fūfĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n18933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. So esp., </sense><sense id="n18933.1" n="I" level="1"> Q. Fufius Calenus, <hi rend="ital">a tribune of the people</hi>, A. U. C. 692, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 14, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:19:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 19, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 15, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 4, 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">from whom the Fufia lex derives its name,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 16, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18933.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An actor otherwise unknown</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fuga: <entryFree id="n18934" type="greek" key="fu^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (archaic <sense id="n18934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> fugaï, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1047" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1047</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:713" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 713</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. bhug'-, bend; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">feu/gw, fugh/</foreign>, flight, <foreign lang="greek">fu/za</foreign>, terror; Germ. biegen, bend. On fugere and flectere, AngloSax. būgan and fleon; Germ. biegen and fliehen, v. Grimm, Deutsch. Wörterb. 1, 1814</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a fleeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a running away</hi> (cf.: effugium, exsilium). </sense><sense id="n18934.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18934.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: quove nunc Auxilio aut exili aut fugae freta sim? Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 44</bibl> (Trag. v. 113 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">mittam illa, fugam ab urbe turpissimam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desperata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dant sese in fugam milites,</quote> <trans><tr>take flight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 95</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in fugam se conferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se conicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:26:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 26, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugae sese mandare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes dare in fugam,</quote> <trans><tr>to put to flight</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 23, 2</bibl></cit>; 5, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: convertere aciem in fugam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 52, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conicere hostes in fugam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 8, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 70, 3: impellere in fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: facere fugam, <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cause flight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put to flight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 56, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 5, 16</bibl> Drak.; 21, 52, 10; 22, 24, 8; 26, 4, 8; but also <hi rend="ital">to take flight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flee</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 53:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 53, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:58:4" default="NO" valid="yes">58, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9, 12</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in Verg., dare fugam, under B.: esse in fuga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 23, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reprimere fugam,</quote> <trans><tr>to prevent</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 26, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem fugae tollere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: exercitum fuga, formidine terroreque complere, Ser. Samm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 9, 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quantae in periculis fugae proximorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:26:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 26, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeres fugae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notusque fugarum Vertit terga Has drubal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:148" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 148</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fugas servorum ri det,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 121</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18934.3" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">flight from one's native land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expatriation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banishment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi exsilium et fugam deprecari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 6, 20</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:8:68" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 8, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">latā fugā damnari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 12, 9</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoties fugas et caedes jussit princeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsilia et fugae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18934.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a flying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swift course</hi> or <hi rend="ital">motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speed</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">qualis equos Threissa fatigat Harpalyce volucremque fugā praevertitur Hebrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui cesserit incitus amnis: Tanta fuga est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:307" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latumque fuga superabitis amnem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 378</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectet facilemquo fugam ventosque ferentes,</quote> <trans><tr>a swift voyage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 430</bibl></cit>; cf.: (Neptunus) fugam dedit et praeter<pb n="788" /> <cb n="FUGI" />  vada fervida vexit, <hi rend="ital">gave a swift passage</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 24</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but different: fugam dant nubila caelo,</quote> <trans><tr>hasten away</tr>, <tr>flee away</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 367</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuga temporum,</quote> <trans><tr>a fleeing away</tr>, <tr>flight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 30, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaere fugam morbi,</quote> <trans><tr>seek the removal of the disorder</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilis hic (equus), cujus clara fuga ante alios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:61" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18934.5" n="2" level="3"> In <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">they who flee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">runaways</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa fugarum, Col. poët. 10, 125: plane fugae merae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n18934.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A place of banishment</hi> or <hi rend="ital">refuge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 2, 130</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18934.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a fleeing from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avoiding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">escape</hi> from an evil; <hi rend="ital">disinclination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aversion</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">simili sunt in culpa, qui officia deserunt mollitia animi, id est laborum et dolorum fuga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuga laboris desidiam coarguit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpitudinis (opp. appetentia honestatis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc ignominiam, vel exsilio vel morte, si alia fuga honoris non esset, vitassem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:67:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 67, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paupertatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pericli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsius lucis (with taedium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:66" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo enim vester Axilla Ala factus est, nisi fugā litterae vastioris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:45:153" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 45, 153</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fugacitas: <entryFree id="n18935" type="gloss" key="fu^ga_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭgācĭtas</orth> <foreign lang="greek">fugh/</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
fugaciter: <entryFree id="n18936" type="main" key="fu^ga_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭgācĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. fugax <sense id="n18936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fugalia: <entryFree id="n18937" type="main" key="fu^ga_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭgālĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>fuga</etym>, <sense id="n18937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a festival celebrated on the</hi> 24<hi rend="ital">th of February</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to commemorate the expulsion of the kings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the flight of the kings</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 2:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 2, 6</bibl>; cf. regifugium.</sense></entryFree>
fugator: <entryFree id="n18938" type="main" key="fu^ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>fugo</etym>, <sense id="n18938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who puts to flight</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mortis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fugatrix: <entryFree id="n18939" type="main" key="fu^ga_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭgātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fugator</etym>, <sense id="n18939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that puts to flight</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dilectio fugatrix timoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fugax: <entryFree id="n18940" type="main" key="fu^gax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭgax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fugio</etym>, <sense id="n18940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">apt to flee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flying swiftly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleet</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf. fugitivus). </sense><sense id="n18940.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugaces Lyncas et cervos cohibentis arcu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 33</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">caprea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:724" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 724</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 591</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 539</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors et fugacem persequitur virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">comes atra (cura) premit sequiturque fugacem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 7, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pholoe,</quote> <trans><tr>who flees from wooers</tr>, <tr>coy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lympha,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventis, volucrique fugacior aurā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:807" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 807</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignavissimus et fugacissimus hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 28, 8</bibl></cit>.—As a term of vituperation, of a slave: <cit><quote lang="la">lurco, edax, furax, fugax,</quote> <trans><tr>runaway</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18940.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18940.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fleeting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transitory</hi>: haec omnia quae habent speciem gloriae, contemne: brevia, fugacia, caduca existima; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 12, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugaces Labuntur anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: blanditiae, Plin. poët. Ep. 7, 4, 7.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non aliud pomum fugacius,</quote> <trans><tr>that sooner spoils</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 12, 11, § 40</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 74" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 74 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n18940.4" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avoiding</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitaeque fugax ambitionis eram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:38" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugax rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugacissimus gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:32" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 32</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭgācĭ-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in fleeing;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum a se audacius an fugacius ab hostibus geratur bellum,</quote> <trans><tr>whether in prosecuting the war his own boldness or the enemy's disposition to flee was the greater</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fugela: <entryFree id="n18941" type="main" key="fu^ge_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭgēla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flight</hi> (ante-and postclass. for fuga): maxima, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 601</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">magna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 336, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fugiens: <entryFree id="n18942" type="main" key="fu^gi^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭgĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from fugio.</entryFree>
fugio: <entryFree id="n18943" type="main" key="fu^gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭgĭo</orth>, <itype>fūgi, fŭgĭtum</itype> (<sense id="n18943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur. part. sync.</hi> fugientum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 18, 1</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">part. fut.</hi> fugiturus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:47 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 47 al.</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [root FUG; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*f*u*g, feu/gw</foreign>; Sanscr. bhuj; syn.: flecto, curvo; v. fuga], <hi rend="ital">to flee</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take flight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">run away.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18943.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18943.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">propera igitur fugere hinc, si te di amant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 78</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex exit foras: ego fugio,</quote> <trans><tr>I am off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervam videre fugere, sectari canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. prol. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui fugisse cum magna pecunia dicitur ac se contulisse Tarquinios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeneas fugiens a Troja,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:33:section=72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 33, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes hostes terga verterunt, nec prius fugere destiterunt, quam ad flumen Rhenum pervenerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppido fugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex ipsa caede,</quote> <trans><tr>to flee</tr>, <tr>escape</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 38, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex proelio Mutinensi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e conspectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 107</bibl></cit>: Uticam, Hor. <cb n="FUGI" /> Ep. 1, 20, 13: fenum habet in cornu; <cit><quote lang="la">longe fuge,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 34</bibl></cit>: nec furtum feci nec fugi, <hi rend="ital">run away</hi> (of slaves), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 46</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">formidare servos, Ne te compilent fugientes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 8</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: ita fugias ne praeter casam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in fleeing from one danger beware of falling into another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit> Ruhnk. —</sense><sense id="n18943.3" n="b" level="4"> In partic., like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">feu/gein</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to become a fugitive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave one's country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go into exile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugiendum de civitate, cedendum bonis aut omnia perferenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ex patria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a patria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:66" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in exilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:160" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 160</bibl></cit>; cf. under II. A. b.—</sense><sense id="n18943.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to pass quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to speed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hasten away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flee away;</hi> cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam Vergilius diem dicit ire, sed fugere, quod currendi genus concitatissimum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and of inanim. and abstr. things): <cit><quote lang="la">tenuis fugiens per gramina rivus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tantalus a labris sitiens fugientia captat Flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concidunt venti fugiuntque nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spernit humum fugiente pennā,</quote> <trans><tr>hasting away</tr>, <tr>rapidly soaring</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum sine vulnere fugit Missile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:770" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 770</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insequitur fugientem lumine pinum (i. e. navem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 469</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugere ad puppim colles campique videntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 389</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugiunt freno non remorante dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:772" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 772</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed fugit interea, fugit irreparabile tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 29, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 7</bibl></cit>.—Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">evolat ante omnes rapidoque per aëra cursu Callaicus Lampon fugit,</quote> <trans><tr>hastens away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:335" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 335</bibl></cit>. Here perh. belongs: acer Gelonus, Cum fugit in Rhodopen atque in deserta Getarum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">swiftly roves</hi> (as a nomade), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 462</bibl> (acc. to another explan., <hi rend="ital">flees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">driven from his abode</hi>).—</sense><sense id="n18943.5" n="b" level="4"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to vanish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disappear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pass away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">e pratis cana pruina fugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:730" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 730</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugiunt de corpore setae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:739" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 739</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam fessae tandem fugiunt de corpore vires,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 447</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: calidusque e corpore sanguis Inducto pallore fugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:755" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 755</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugerat ore color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi causa morbi Fugerit venis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugiunt cum sanguine vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:859" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 859</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:12:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriane fugerit in annalibus digerendis, an, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 44, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratissima sunt poma, cum fugiunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>when they wilt</tr>, <tr>become wilted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: vinum fugiens, under <pos>P. a.</pos>—</sense><sense id="n18943.6" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nos naturam sequamur, et ab omni, quod abhorret ab oculorum auriumque approbatione, fugiamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 35, 128</bibl></cit>;
