cf.: omne animal appetit quaedam et fugit a quibusdam; <cit><quote lang="la">quod autem refugit, id contra naturam est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:13:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 13, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad verba,</quote> <trans><tr>to have recourse to</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 132</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n18943.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flee from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seek to avoid; to avoid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shun</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n18943.8" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): erravi, post cognovi, et fugio cognitum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 24, 38</bibl> (Trag. v. 160 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum Domitius concilia conventusque hominum fugeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem neque populum neque privatum fugio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vesanum fugiunt poëtam qui sapiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:455" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 455</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percontatorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupus me fugit inermem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 22, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc et ovis ultro fugiat lupus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Peleus) Hippolyten dum fugit abstinens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptorum chorus omnis amat nemus et fugit urbes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 6, 126</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">data pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 287</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:323" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 323</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic litora vento Incipiente fremunt, fugitur cum portus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>is left</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:140" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 140</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n18943.9" n="b" level="4"> In partic. (cf. supra, I. A. b.), <hi rend="ital">to leave one's country</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos patriam fugimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Teucer Salamina patremque cum fugeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 22</bibl></cit>.—Hence: <cit><quote lang="la">quis exsul Se quoque fugit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18943.10" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (causa pro effectu), <hi rend="ital">to flee away from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to escape</hi>, = effugio (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">but cf. infra, B. 2.): hac Quirinus Martis equis Acheronta fugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidiatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta manus avidas fugient heredis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 7, 19</bibl></cit>.—And in a poetically inverted mode of expression: nullum Saeva caput Proserpina fugit (= nemo tam gravis est, ad quem mors non accedat), <hi rend="ital">none does cruel Proserpine flee away from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avoid</hi> (i. e. <hi rend="ital">none escapes death</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18943.11" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to flee from</hi>, <cb n="FUGI" /> <hi rend="ital">avoid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shun</hi> (very freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">conspectum multitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignominiam ac dedecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam molestiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 114</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 459</bibl> (opp. ferre): <cit><quote lang="la">recordationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vituperationem tarditatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:24:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 24, 101</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">majoris opprobria culpae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 33, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc voluptatem (with reformidare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinas omnes (Epicurus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 17, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">usum conjugis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 565</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conubia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplexus senis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:74" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sequar aut fugiam, quae diligit ipse vel odit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spondeum et dactylum (opp. sequi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:87" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 87</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simili inscitiā mors fugitur, quasi dissolutio naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:11:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemadmodum ratione in vivendo fugitur invidia, sic, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 38, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si curam fugimus, virtus fugienda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugiendas esse nimias amicitias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugienda semper injuria est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:8:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 8, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:43:section=103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 43, § 103</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiosum genus fugiendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:56:189" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 56, 189</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:128" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 128</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">petenda ac fugienda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18943.12" n="(b)" level="5"> Like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">feu/gein</foreign>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <hi rend="ital">to avoid doing</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">to omit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forbear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beware</hi>, = omittere, cavere: <cit><quote lang="la">illud in his rebus longe fuge credere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1052" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1052</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o fuge te tenerae puerorum credere turbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:9" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid sit futurum cras, fuge quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: fuge suspicari, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mene igitur socium summis adjungere rebus, Nise, fugis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 200</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugeres radice vel herbā Proficiente nihil curarier,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 150</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque illud fugerim dicere, ut Caelius, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:38:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 38, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic donis patris triumphum decorare fugiendum fuit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 5, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18943.13" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (causa pro effectu; cf. supra, II. A. 2.), <hi rend="ital">to escape</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> also of things as subjects): <cit><quote lang="la">tanta est animi tenuitas, ut fugiat aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:22:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 22, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:80" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tamen admiror, quo pacto judicium illud Fugerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos viros vigilantia fugit,</quote> <trans><tr>whom any vigilance escapes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 265</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 9, 54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18943.14" n="b" level="4"> Esp. freq., res me fugit, <hi rend="ital">it escapes me</hi>, <hi rend="ital">escapes my notice; I do not observe it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">do not know it</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">latet, praeterit): novus ille populus vidit tamen id, quod fugit Lacedaemonium Lycurgum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illos id fugerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:23:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 23, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem amentem hoc fugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:12:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 12, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem res nulla fugeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (ratio) neque Solonem Atheniensem fugerat, neque nostrum senatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 34</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 16: non fugisset hoc Graecos homines, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:59:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 59, 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem haec utilitas fugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi quae me forte fugiunt, hae sunt fere de animo sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:11:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 11, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:107" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:40" default="NO">7, 1, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam rem esse declarant in usu positam militari, quae hujus viri scientiam fugere possit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (partitio) fugiet memoriam judicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:18:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 18, 6</bibl>.—With a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Dionysio, fugit me ad te antea scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 18, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud alterum quam sit difficile, te non fugit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 42, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭgĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">fleeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleeting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vanishing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18943.15" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:752" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 752</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra deficiunt, fugienti languida vitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:887" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 887</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <trans><tr>growing flat</tr>, <tr>spoiling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:23:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 23, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ocelli,</quote> <trans><tr>dying</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:9:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 9, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus fugiens ad litora,</quote> <trans><tr>running back</tr>, <tr>retreating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 15.—</sense><sense id="n18943.16" n="2" level="3"> <pos>Subst.</pos> in the later jurid. lang., like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o( feu/gwn</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the defendant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnimodo hoc et ab actore et a fugiente exigi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 2, 58, § 4</bibl></cit> (for which, reus, § 7).— </sense><sense id="n18943.17" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo erat adeo tardus aut fugiens laboris, quin, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>averse to labor</tr>, <tr>indolent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:69:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 69, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solitudinis (with appeteus communionis ac societatis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 10, 18</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, and <pos>adv.</pos> do not occur.</sense></entryFree>
fugitans: <entryFree id="n18944" type="main" key="fu^gi^tans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭgĭtans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from fugito.</entryFree>
fugitivarius: <entryFree id="n18945" type="main" key="fu^gi^ti_va_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭgĭtīvārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>fugitivus</etym>. <sense id="n18945.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One employed to catch and bring back fugitive slaves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a slave-catcher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:19:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 19, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:5:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 5, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18945.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: (cochleae) aquā finiendae, ne fugitivarius sit parandus, <hi rend="ital">that they may not crawl away</hi>, Varr. <pb n="789" /> <cb n="FUGO" /> R. R. 3, 14, 1.—</sense><sense id="n18945.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A concealer of runaway slaves</hi>, Cod. Th. 10, 12, 1.</sense></entryFree>
fugitivus: <entryFree id="n18946" type="main" key="fu^gi^ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭgĭtīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fugio</etym>, <sense id="n18946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fleeing away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fugitive;</hi> usually <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭgĭtī-vus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a fugitive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">runaway</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deserter.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18946.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: dicitur mihi tuus servus anagnostes fugitivus cum Vardaeis esse, <hi rend="ital">runaway slave</hi>, Vat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 9, 2</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">servus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 56:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 56, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:5:5 al" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 5, 5 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(apes) fugitivae fiunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>they fly away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:50" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis fugitivus appellatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 23, § 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retraham ad me illud fugitivum argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teque ipsum vitas fugitivus et erro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 113</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18946.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tam fugitivi illi a dominis, quam tu ab jure et ab legibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:50:section=112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 50, § 112</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18946.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">futurum te fugitivum rei familiaris statimque ad nos evolaturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 28, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jugurtha finium suorum regnique fugitivus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:1:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illius loci (columbae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 41, § 142</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18946.4" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n18946.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A runaway</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fugitive slave</hi>: non fugitivost hic homo; <cit><quote lang="la">conmeminit domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis sit fugitivus, definit Orfilius: Fugitivus est, qui extra domini domum fugae causa, quo se a domino celaret, mansit. Caelius autem fugitivum esse ait eum, qui ea mente discedat, ne ad dominum redeat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivebat cum fugitivis, cum facinorosis, cum barbaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:22:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 22, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:26:section=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 26, § 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 110, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:43:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 43, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:18:14 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 18, 14 al.</bibl>—As a vituperative term: <cit><quote lang="la">fur, fugitive, fraus populi, fraudulente, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 38</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n18946.6" n="B" level="2"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a runaway soldier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a deserter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea res per fugitivos L. Aemilii hostibus nuntiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 23, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 3, 67</bibl> Dietsch; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus discernit emansorem a fugitivo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:16:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 16, § 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fugito: <entryFree id="n18947" type="main" key="fu^gi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭgĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>fugio</etym>, <sense id="n18947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to flee eagerly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in haste</hi> (mostly ante-class.). </sense><sense id="n18947.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita miserrimus fui fugitando, ne quis me cognosceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeci fugitantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18947.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avoid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shun</hi> (cf. fugio, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">herum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicos senes deditā operā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illum amant, me fugitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (puellam) famulae longe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amaracinum fugitat sus et timet omne Unguentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:973" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 973</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid illuc est, quod meos te dicam fugitare oculos?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tuum conspectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugitant omnes hanc provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">55</bibl>: qui quaestionem fugitant, bona possident, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:28:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 28, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugitant (cornices) iras Palladis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:753" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 753</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18947.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (cf. fugio, II. B. 1. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">to avoid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forbear to do</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">quod aliae meretrices facere fugitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicumque suos fugitabant visere ad aegros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1235</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:658" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 658</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭgĭtans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">fleeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avoiding;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugitans litium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 77</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
fugitor: <entryFree id="n18948" type="hapax" key="fu^gi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭgĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>fugio</etym>, <sense id="n18948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who flees</hi> or <hi rend="ital">runs away</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 97</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fugo: <entryFree id="n18949" type="main" key="fu^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cause to flee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put to flight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chase away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discomfit</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui homines inermes armis, viris, terrore repulerit, fugarit, averterit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 12, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fugatus, pulsus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 31</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">23, 64: Latini ad Veserim fusi et fugati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:31:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 31, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes (with fundere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 21, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:58:3" default="NO" valid="yes">58, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:46" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fugato omni equitatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:68:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 68, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugatis equitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 101:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 101, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugato duce altero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:36:1" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 36, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibalem Lares Romanā sede fugantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit> (4, 2), 11: <cit><quote lang="la">indoctum doctumque fugat recitator acerbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:474" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 474</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi me mea Musa fugasset,</quote> <trans><tr>had not sent me into exile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:5:21" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 5, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">longe fugati conspectu ex hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum rediens fugat astra Phoebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:21:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 21, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugatis tenebris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(flammas) a classe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maculas ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Med. Fac. 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugat e templis oculos Bona diva virorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:637" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 637</bibl></cit>: tela sonante fugat nervo, <hi rend="ital">lets fly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discharges</hi>, Sil. <cb n="FULC" /> 2, 91: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe etiam audacem fugat hoc terretque poëtam, Quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 182</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">id quidem multos a proposito studendi fugat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugat hoc (telum), facit illud amorem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:469 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 469 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostro de corde fugabitur ardor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:502" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 502</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Martia cui somnos classica pulsa fugent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:4" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fulcimen: <entryFree id="n18950" type="main" key="fulci_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulcīmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>fulcio</etym>, <sense id="n18950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pillar</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">terra nullo fulcimine nixa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:269" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 269</bibl></cit>. Cf. the foll. art.</sense></entryFree>
fulcimentum: <entryFree id="n18951" type="main" key="fulci_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulcīmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 109 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12:section=19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 12, § 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fulcinius: <entryFree id="n18952" type="main" key="Fulci_nius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fulcīnius</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n18952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Fulcinius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Fulcinius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 4, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fulcio: <entryFree id="n18953" type="main" key="fulci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulcĭo</orth>, <itype>fulsi, fultum, 4</itype> (late form <sense id="n18953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> FVLCIVIT, Inscr. ap. Mur. 466, 3.—<hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulcītus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:46" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 46</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; cf.: falx, flccto; Corss. refers it to root dhar-; v. firmus, Ausspr. 1, 476</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to prop up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to keep upright by props</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi> (class.; syn.: sustento, sustineo, munio). </sense><sense id="n18953.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui fulcire putatur porticum Stoicorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 24, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid trabibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atlas, caelum qui vertice fulcit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis nisi fulta est, fertur ad terram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruentes ceras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 10, 10, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum Balbutit Scaurum pravis fultum male talis,</quote> <trans><tr>supported</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 48</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod non Taenariis domus est mihi fulta columnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 1, 49: <cit><quote lang="la">longis Numidarum fulta columnis cenatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:182" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 182</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:193" default="NO">3, 193</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mutuatus pecuniam aedificia ruentia fulserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:73" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me prior fultusque toro meliore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:82" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 82</bibl></cit>: et pulvino fultus, <hi rend="ital">supported by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resting on the pillow</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 6, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille (juvencus) latus niveum molli fultus byacintho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 53</bibl></cit>; cf. effultus; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colloco, fulcio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput nivei fultum Pallantis,</quote> <trans><tr>propped up</tr>, <tr>bolstered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 39</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sat sic fultumst mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 37</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu (potes) pedibus teneris positas fulcire pruinas?</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to tread the fallen snow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stant fulti pulvere crines,</quote> <trans><tr>supported</tr>, <tr>stiffened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:326" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 326</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18953.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make strong</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strengthen</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">fultosque emuniit obice postes,</quote> <trans><tr>fastened</tr>, <tr>guarded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 227</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">appositā janua fulta serā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et dura janua fulta sera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia debet cibus integrare novando Et fulcire cibus, cibus omnia sustentare,</quote> <trans><tr>to support</tr>, <tr>strengthen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachum cibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 68" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 68 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venas cadentes vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 95</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:24:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 24, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18953.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18953.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sustain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uphold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veterem amicum suum labentem excepit, fulsit et sustinuit re, fortuna, fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:16:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 16, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">labantem et prope cadentem rem publicam fulcire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:21:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 21, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum pluribus adminiculis ante fundatam fulcit ac sustinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 21, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">cf: ingenia rudia nullisque artium bonarum adminiculis fulta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:2:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc consilio et quasi senatu fultus et munitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 21, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnis subsidiis fulta res publica est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium gloria fultum et benevolentiā sociorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:22:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 22, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his fultus societatibus atque amicitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 12, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:60:9" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 60, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 11</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quia nullis recentibus subsidiis fulta prima acies fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:32:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 32, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo praesidio cum fulta res Romana esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa Gaditanorum gravissimis et plurimis rebus est fulta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 15, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serie fulcite genus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to keep up</tr>, <tr>preserve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 69.—* </sense><sense id="n18953.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to besiege</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Pacuvii) Antiopa aerumnis cor luctificabile fulta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:78" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 78</bibl></cit> (perh. a word of Pacuv.).</sense></entryFree>
fulcipedia: <entryFree id="n18954" type="main" key="fulci^pe^di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulcĭpĕdĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fulcio-pes</etym>, <sense id="n18954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">propfoot</hi>, of a drunken woman, who needs support, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 75, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fulcitus: <entryFree id="n18955" type="main" key="fulci_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulcītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. fulcio <sense id="n18955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fulcrum: <entryFree id="n18956" type="main" key="fulcrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulcrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>fulcio</etym>, <sense id="n18956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the post</hi> or <hi rend="ital">foot of a couch</hi> (a bed or an eating-couch), <hi rend="ital">a bedpost</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eburnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:13:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 13, 21</bibl></cit> (3, 5, 5 M.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:14" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tricliniorum pedibus fulcrisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 2, 4, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurea fulcra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:604" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 604</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 32</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">plutei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 68.—</sense><sense id="n18956.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (pars <cb n="FULG" /> pro toto), <hi rend="ital">a couch</hi> at table, <hi rend="ital">bed-lounge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 7, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:22" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:95" default="NO">11, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumeum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fulctura: <entryFree id="n18957" type="main" key="fulctu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulctūra</orth>, v. fultura.</entryFree>
fulfulae: <entryFree id="n18958" type="main" key="Fulfu^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fulfŭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n18958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of the Samnites</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 20, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fulgens: <entryFree id="n18959" type="main" key="fulgens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulgens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from fulgeo.</entryFree>
fulgenter: <entryFree id="n18960" type="main" key="fulgenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulgenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. fulgeo, <sense id="n18960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fulgentius: <entryFree id="n18961" type="main" key="Fulgenti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fulgentĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Fabius Planciades Fulgentius, <sense id="n18961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman mythographer and grammarian in the beginning of the sixth century of the Christian era.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fulgeo: <entryFree id="n18962" type="main" key="fulgeo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulgeo</orth>, <itype>fulsi, 2</itype> (ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg> form acc. to the third conj.: fulgit, Lucil. and Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 506, 8</bibl> and 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:768" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 768</bibl> Lachm. <sense id="n18962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> 6, 160; 174; 214; fulgĕre, Pac., Att., Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 506, 17 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1095" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1095</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:165" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 165</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:826" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 826</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:284 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 284 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:56" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 56</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Sanscr, bhrāg', to glow, gleam; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fle/gw, flege/qw</foreign>, to burn, <foreign lang="greek">flo/c</foreign>, flame; <cit><quote lang="la">Lat. fulgur, fulmen, fulvus, flagrare, flamma, flāmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 187" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 187</bibl></cit></etym>, <hi rend="ital">to flash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lighten</hi> (syn.: fulguro, splendeo, luceo). </sense><sense id="n18962.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si fulserit, si tonuerit, si tactum aliquid erit de caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:72:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 72, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aestate vehementius tonuit quam fulsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18</bibl></cit>. 35, 81, § 354; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:165" default="NO" valid="yes">165</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jove fulgente cum populo agi nefas esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 8, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Jove fulgente, tonante ... caelo fulgente, tonante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:25:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 25, 65</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. fulguro: tremulo tempestas impete fulgit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulsere ignes et aether,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">picei fulsere poli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:622" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 622</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n18962.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of the vivid oratory of Pericles: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Pericles) si tenui genere uteretur, numquam ab Aristophane poëta fulgere, tonare, permiscere Graeciam dictus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 9, 29</bibl></cit> (acc. to Aristoph. Acharn. 530 sq.: <foreign lang="greek">*perikle/hs *ou)lu/mpios *)/hstrapten, e)bro/nta, cuneku/ka th\n *(ella/da</foreign>); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgurare ac tonare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18962.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to flash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glitter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gleam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glisten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shine</hi> (syn. splendeo). </sense><sense id="n18962.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nitent unguentis, qui fulgent purpurā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmorea tecta ebore et auro fulgentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:3:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 1, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgentia signis castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: qui caelum versat stellis fulgentibus aptum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 30 Vahl.); so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> (Ann. v. 162 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">caelo fulgebat luna sereno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:1" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 15, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:722" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 722</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgens contremuit domus Saturni (i. e. caelum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">micantes fulsere gladii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgente decorus arcu Phoebus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Carm. Sec. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">felium in tenebris fulgent radiantque oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgentes oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 12, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgentes Cycladae (on account of their marble),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 28, 14</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">nitentes Cycladae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14, 19</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">stet Capitolium fulgens (corresp. to lucidae sedes Olympi),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti quod erat solis fulgebat in armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:108" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 108</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18962.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to shine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glitter; be conspicuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illustrious</hi> (rare and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">(virtus) Intaminatis fulget honoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indoles virtutis jam in adulescentulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quondam nobili fulsi patre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 209" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgens imperio fertilis Africae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgens sacerdotio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sanguine fulget Juli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:42" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 42</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ful-gens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">shining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glittering;</hi> in a trop. sense, <hi rend="ital">illustrious.—Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 115:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 115, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Messala fulgentissimus juvenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:71:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 71, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:39:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 39, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(M. Tullius) fulgentissimo et caelesti ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:64:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 64, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo fulgentissima cognomina patris et patrui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:5:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fulgenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">glitteringly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resplendently.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18962.6" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia sic fulgentius radiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 20, 22, § 43</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n18962.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgentius instrui poterat luxuria, certe innocentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 2, 3, § 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fulgerator: <entryFree id="n18963" type="gloss" key="fulge^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulgĕrātor</orth>, v. fulgurator, II.</entryFree>
fulgesco: <entryFree id="n18964" type="hapax" key="fulgesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulgesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n18964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [fulgeo], <hi rend="ital">to flash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to glitter</hi>: solis radiatione fulgescere, Firm. Astr. 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fulgetra: <entryFree id="n18965" type="main" key="fulge_^tra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulgē^tra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n18965.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
fulgetrum: <entryFree id="n18966" type="main" key="fulge_^trum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulgē^trum</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<sense id="n18966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem. plur. acc.</hi> fulgetras, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 5, § 25</bibl>.—Post-class. <number>plur.</number> fulgitrua, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:F. 183" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> F. 183</bibl>, unless we should read fulgetra), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>fulgeo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">heat-lightning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lightning</hi>: Heraclitus existimat fulgurationem esse velut apud nos incipientium ignium <pb n="790" /> <cb n="FULG" /> conatus et primum flammam incertam, modo intereuntem modo resurgentem. Haec antiqui fulgetra dicebant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:56:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 56, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 54, 55, § 142</bibl>: si in nube luctetur flatus aut vapor, tonitrua edi; si erumpat ardens, fulmina; <cit><quote lang="la">si longiore tractu nitatur, fulgetra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 43, 43, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae pingi non possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 96</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fulgidulus: <entryFree id="n18967" type="hapax" key="fulgi^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulgĭdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n18967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [fulgidus], <hi rend="ital">shining a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat bright</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2388" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2388</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
fulgidus: <entryFree id="n18968" type="main" key="fulgi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulgĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fulgeo</etym>, <sense id="n18968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flashing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glittering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shining</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 363</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies ornatu fulgida Martis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 2, 351</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 5, 41, 15</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: fulgidier radio, Ven. Carm. 8, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fulginia: <entryFree id="n18969" type="main" key="Fulgi^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fulgĭnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n18969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Umbria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Perusia and Spoletium</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Foligno</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:462" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 462</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2409</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18969.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fulgĭnas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Fulginia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Fulginian</hi>: municipium, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 768</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">in praefectura Fulginate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> (Cic. vol. xi. p. 4 B. and K.). —In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fulgĭnĭātes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ful-gĭnātes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Fulginia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Fulginians;</hi> form Fulginiates, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 14, 19, § 113</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">form Fulginates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Don.</author> 2</bibl></cit>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 70 al.</sense></entryFree>
fulgitrua: <entryFree id="n18970" type="main" key="fulgi^tru^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulgĭtrŭa</orth>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. fulgetrum.</entryFree>
fulgo: <entryFree id="n18971" type="main" key="fulgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. fulgeo <sense id="n18971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fulgor: <entryFree id="n18972" type="main" key="fulgor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulgor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>fulgeo</etym>, <sense id="n18972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lightning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a flash of lightning</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for fulgur): <cit><quote lang="la">fulgorem quoque cernimus ante Quam tonitrum accipimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 170</bibl></cit> Lachm. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 217</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 524</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:619" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 619</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: prospera Juppiter his dextris fulgoribus edit, Cic. poët. Div. 2, 39, 82; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(anhelitus terrae) cum se in nubem induerint, tum et fulgores et tonitrua exsistere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 19, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18972.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">flash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glitter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gleam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brightness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendor</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n18972.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (candelabri) fulgore collucere atque illustrari Jovis templum oportebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:32:section=71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 32, § 71</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 33, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:617" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 617</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">purpureae abollae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 15, 13, § 64</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 54, § 142</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carbunculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 25, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos tremulo fulgore micantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:721" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 721</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgor ab auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non fumum ex fulgore, sed ex fumo dare lucem Cogitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellae solis fulgore obumbrantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:1:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum stupet insanis acies fulgoribus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>glittering utensils</tr>, <tr>plate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n18972.3" n="2" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a shining star</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde est hominum generi prosperus et salutaris ille fulgor, qui dicitur Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18972.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">brightness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renown</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominis et famae quondam fulgore trahebar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:12:39" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 12, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:1:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus fulgore quodam suae claritatis tenebras obduxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urit fulgore suo qui praegravat artes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 26, 27, § 95</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fulgora: <entryFree id="n18973" type="main" key="Fulgo^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fulgŏra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fulgur</etym>, <sense id="n18973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goddess who presided over lightning</hi>, Sen. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 6:10" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 6, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fulgur: <entryFree id="n18974" type="main" key="fulgur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulgur</orth> (also in the <case>nom.</case> FVLGVS, acc. to Fest. s. v. fulgere, p. 92 <sense id="n18974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>), <itype>ŭris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>fulgeo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">flashing lightning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lightning.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18974.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (=splendor fulminis, opp. fulmen, a thunderbolt): <cit><quote lang="la">fulgur, ignis qui coruscat fulmine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem modo fit fulgur, quod tantum splendet, et fulmen, quod incendit ... fulmen est fulgur intentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:57:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 57, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimbi immixtaque fulgura ventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credas et rapidum Aetnaeo fulgur ab igne jaci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:574" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 574</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">passim fremitus et fulgura fiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">CAELI FVLGVRA REGIONIBVS RATIS TEMPERANTO,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de fulgurum vi dubitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:10:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 10, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgura interpretantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: consultus de fulgure haruspex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:47 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 47 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonitrua et fulgura paulo infirmius expavescebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:90" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 90</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ad omnia fulgura pallent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:223" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonitruque et fulgure terruit orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:817" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 817</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dium fulgur appellabant diurnum, quod putabant Jovis, ut nocturnum Summani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=75" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 75</bibl></cit> Müll.; <cb n="FULI" /> cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">provorsum fulgur appellatur, quod ignoratur noctu an interdiu sit factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=229" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 229</bibl></cit> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n18974.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18974.3" n="A" level="2"> For fulmen, <hi rend="ital">a lightning-flash</hi> that descends and strikes, <hi rend="ital">a thunder-bolt</hi> (not in class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">feriunt summos fulgura montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 391</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelo ceciderunt plura sereno fulgura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 488</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18974.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in relig. lang.: condere fulgur, <hi rend="ital">to bury a thing struck by lightning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquis senior, qui publica fulgura condit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:586" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 586</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">‡ fulgur conditum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2482</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 606</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18974.5" n="B" level="2"> For fulgor, <hi rend="ital">brightness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendor</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 164</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">flammaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 725</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nictantia flammae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarae coruscis Fulguribus tedae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 297</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">galeae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Hon. 3, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fulguralis: <entryFree id="n18975" type="main" key="fulgu^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulgŭrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fulgur</etym>, <sense id="n18975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to lightning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etruscorum et haruspicini et fulgurales et rituales libri,</quote> <trans><tr>treating of lightning as an omen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 33, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 5, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fulguratio: <entryFree id="n18976" type="main" key="fulgu^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulgŭrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fulguro</etym>, <sense id="n18976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sheetlightning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lightning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulguratio est late ignis explicitus: fulmen est coactus ignis et impetu jactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:2:12" default="NO">2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:21" default="NO">21</bibl>; 56.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes mediocriter collisae fulgurationes faciunt: efficiunt majore impetu pulsae fulmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fulgurator: <entryFree id="n18977" type="main" key="fulgu^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulgŭrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>fulgur</etym>. <sense id="n18977.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A priest who interprets and propitiates lightning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lightning-interpreter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulguratores, ut extispices et haruspices, ita hi fulgurum inspectores. Cato de moribus Claudii Neronis: haruspicem, fulguratorem si quis adducat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 63, 21 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:53:109" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 53, 109</bibl>. —Also written ‡ <cit><quote lang="la">fulguriator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2301</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18977.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A lightning-hurler</hi>, App. de Mundo; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 21, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also written ‡ fulgerator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4</bibl>; Don. cl. 1, 1.</sense></entryFree>
fulguratura: <entryFree id="n18978" type="main" key="fulgu^ra_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulgŭrātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fulguro</etym>, <sense id="n18978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the interpretation of lightnings</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Etrusci libri de fulguratura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fulgureus: <entryFree id="n18979" type="main" key="fulgu^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulgŭrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fulgur</etym>, <sense id="n18979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of lightning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charged with lightning</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">nubes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 427</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fulguriator: <entryFree id="n18980" type="gloss" key="fulgu^ri^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulgŭrĭātor</orth>, v. fulgurator, I.</entryFree>
fulgurio: <entryFree id="n18981" type="main" key="fulgu^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulgŭrĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n18981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [fulgur] (ante-class.). </sense><sense id="n18981.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hurl lightnings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lighten</hi>: suo sonitu claro fulgurivit Juppiter, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 110, 17</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 13 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n18981.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to strike with lightning;</hi> only in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulguritum id quod est fulmine ictum: qui locus statim fieri putabatur religiosus, quod eum deus sibi dicasse videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=92" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 92</bibl></cit> Müll.; so as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fulgŭrī-tum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which has been struck by lightning</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1</bibl>: fulguritae arbores, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 110, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=70" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 70</bibl> Müll.; of a person: quasi fulguritus, Sen. de Ira, 3, 23, 6.</sense></entryFree>
fulguro: <entryFree id="n18982" type="main" key="fulgu^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulgŭro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n18982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to lighten</hi> (less freq. than fulgeo; in many MSS. the reading oscillates between the two words; cf. Spald. and Zumpt ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 19</bibl>, and Mos. and Orell. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:25:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N.
