D. 2, 25, 65</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n18982.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctu magis quam interdiu sine tonitribus fulgurat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 54, 55, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex omnibus partibus caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 35, 81, § 354</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jove tonante, fulgurante comitia populi habere nefas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:18:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 18, 43</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgurat, cum repentinum late lumen emicuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:57:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 57, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18982.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18982.3" n="A" level="2"> Of oratory (cf. fulgeo, I. B.): fulgurat in ullo umquam verius dicta vis eloquentiae? Plin. H. N. praef. § 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 19</bibl> (v. fulgeo, I. B.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18982.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To flash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glitter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glisten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shine</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">vetitoque domus jam fulgurat auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:191" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cernis, oculis qui fulgurat ignis!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:723" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 723</bibl></cit>.—<mood>Part.</mood>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fulgŭrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> only as <hi rend="ital">subst. plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fulgŭrāta</orth>, <itype>orum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">things struck by lightning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus fulguratis odor sulphuris inest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:21:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 21, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fulica: <entryFree id="n18983" type="main" key="fu^li^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭlĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭlix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 8, 14), <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n18983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a coot</hi>, a water-fowl, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:122 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 44, § 122 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 363</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:625" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 625</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fuliginatus: <entryFree id="n18984" type="main" key="fu_li_gi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūlīgĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fuligo</etym>, <sense id="n18984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">painted with a black powder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powdered black</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">orbes oculorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 10</bibl></cit>. <cb n="FULM" /></sense></entryFree>
fuligineus: <entryFree id="n18985" type="main" key="fu_li_gi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūlīgĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fuligo</etym>, <sense id="n18985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like soot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sooty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 108, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fuliginosus: <entryFree id="n18986" type="main" key="fu_li_gi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūlīgĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of soot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sooty</hi> (post-class.): Lares, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 261.</sense></entryFree>
fuligo: <entryFree id="n18987" type="main" key="fu_li_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūlīgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. fumus; v. Fick, Vergl. Wörterb. p. 104</etym>, <sense id="n18987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soot.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18987.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">os oblitum fuligine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi fuligine abstersa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:36:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 36, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:60" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucubrationum bibenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(haerens) nigro fuligo Maroni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:227" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 227</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18987.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">black paint</hi> (= stibium): <cit><quote lang="la">supercilium madidā fuligine tactum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:93" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 93</bibl></cit>.—*</sense><sense id="n18987.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">paint</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">atra verborum et argutiarum fuligine ob oculos audientium jacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fulix: <entryFree id="n18988" type="main" key="fu^lix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭlix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, v. fulica.</entryFree>
fullo: <entryFree id="n18989" type="main" key="fullo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fullo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n18989.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fuller</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cloth-fuller</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 6, 18, § 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:93:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 93, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:7:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:143" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:162 al" default="NO">162 al.</bibl>—In mal. part.: comprimere fullonem, Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 879</bibl> P. (Com. Rel. v. 95 Rib.); <cit><quote lang="la">hence: pugil Cleomachus intra cutem caesus et ultra, inter fullones Novianos coronandus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18989.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The title of a comic poem written by Laberius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 7, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18989.2" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18989.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A beetle with white spots</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 11, 30, § 100</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fullonica: <entryFree id="n18990" type="main" key="fullo_ni^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fullōnĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> and <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. fullonicus, II.</entryFree>
fullonicus: <entryFree id="n18991" type="main" key="fullo_ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fullōnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fullo</etym>, <sense id="n18991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to fullers.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18991.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pila,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18991.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fullōnĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n18991.3" n="A" level="2"> (Sc. ars.) <hi rend="ital">The fuller's craft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fulling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si non didicisti fullonicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 57</bibl></cit> (dub. fulloniam, Fleck.): <cit><quote lang="la">fullonicam docere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 18, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6 praef.</bibl> § 7.—</sense><sense id="n18991.4" n="B" level="2"> (Sc. officina.) <hi rend="ital">A fuller's shop</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum, in cujus fundo aqua oritur, fullonicas circa fontem instituisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:3:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fullonica</orth>, <itype>orum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:13:section=8" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 7, 1, 13, § 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fullonius: <entryFree id="n18992" type="main" key="fullo_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fullōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to fullers.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18992.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <trans><tr>the art of fulling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creta,</quote> <trans><tr>fuller's earth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 8, 4, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 13, 68, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus,</quote> <trans><tr>a jumping in fulling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 15</bibl></cit>.—Comically: nisi lenoni munus hodie misero, Cras mihi potandus fructus (perh. fucus) est fullonius, <hi rend="ital">to-morrow I must swallow ink</hi> (acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">must let myself be stamped upon</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 1, 15</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n18992.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n18992.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">fullōnium</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (=fullonica, II. B.), <hi rend="ital">a fuller's shop</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18992.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">fullōnia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the fuller's trade</hi> (sc. ars): <cit><quote lang="la">si non didicisti fulloniam, non mirandumst,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 57</bibl></cit> Fleck. (al. fullonicam).</sense></entryFree>
fulmen: <entryFree id="n18993" type="main" key="fulmen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>contr. from fulgimen, v. fulgeo</etym>, <sense id="n18993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lightning that strikes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sets on fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a thunderbolt</hi> (opp. fulgur, lightning). </sense><sense id="n18993.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">placet Stoicis, eos anhelitus terrae cum se in nubem induerint ejusque tenuissimam quamque partem coeperint dividere atque dirumpere, tum et fulgores et tonitrua exsistere: si autem nubium conflictu ardor expressus se emiserit, id esse fulmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 19, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim te puto esse eum, qui Jovi fulmen fabricatos esse Cyclopas in Aetna putes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:19:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 19, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter fulmina et tonitrua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">under II.: Phaëthon ictu fulminis deflagravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:25:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 25, 94</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Romulus lactens fulmine ictus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21, 47</bibl></cit> (for which more usually: <cit><quote lang="la">e caelo ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:10:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 10, 16</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">fulmine tactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:144" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulminis ictu concidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:20:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 20, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmine percussus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 22, 57</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:35:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 35, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmina emittere ... fulmen jacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:19:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19, 44</bibl></cit> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">fulminis ictus evadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:17" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmine justo ruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ideo plurima aestate fiunt fulmina, qua plurimum calidi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:57:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 57, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">validum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">igniferum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 379</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caducum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualem ministrum fulminis alitem, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (Periclem) fulminibus et caelesti fragori comparant comici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fulgeo, I. B.: ipse Pater corusca fulmina molitur dextra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 330</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmen erat, Genitor quae plurima caelo deicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmina pauper creditur atque deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:145" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 145</bibl></cit>.—Respecting the nature of lightnings, and their religious interpretation<pb n="791" /> <cb n="FULM" />  among the Etruscans and Romans, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:12 sq" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 12 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 51, 52, § 137</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">230</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18993.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a thunderbolt</hi>, i. q. <hi rend="ital">destructive power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crushing calamity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non dubitaverim me gravissimis tempestatibus ac paene fulminibus ipsis obvium ferre conservandorum civium causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 4</bibl></cit> (so we should read, and not fluminibus; cf. the passage quoted above from <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:19:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 19, 43</bibl>; besides, if the figure were that of waves, it would be expressed not by fluminibus, but by fluctibus; v. fluctus, II. B.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmina fortunae contemnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:27:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 27, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juro per mea mala, has me in illo (puero) vidisse virtutes ingenii, ut prorsus posset hinc esse tanti fulminis (i. e. mortis pueri) metus, quod observatum fere est, celerius occidere festinatam maturitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6 praef.</bibl></cit> § 10; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 41, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam fulmine justo Et Capito et Numitor ruerint, damnante senatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:92" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 92</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:39:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 39, 7</bibl>.—Of oratory: <cit><quote lang="la">ain' tandem? insanire tibi videris (Paetus), quod imitere verborum meorum, ut scribis, fulmina? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(stilus) nec acumine posteriorum nec fulmine utens superiorum (al. flumine),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:6:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 6, 21</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmen habent acres in aduncis dentibus apri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>destructive power</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 550</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:305" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 305</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aper) Erectus setis et aduncae fulmine malae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:470" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 470</bibl></cit>; see fulmineus, II.: tune illum (Hannibalem), cum frons propior lumenque corusco Igne micat, tune illa viri, quae vertice fundit, Fulmina pertuleris, <hi rend="ital">fiery flashings</hi> (of the eye), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:342" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 342</bibl>.—Applied to the Scipios, as heroes and conquerors of the Carthaginians: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipiades, belli fulmen, Carthaginis horror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1034" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1034</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">imitated: duo fulmina belli Scipiadae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:843" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 843</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi nunc sunt fulmina gentis Scipiadae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:106" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo fulmina nostri imperii, Cn. et P. Scipiones,</quote> <trans><tr>these two thunderbolts of our empire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 15, 34</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">Fulmen est, ubi cum potestate habitat iracundia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0622,001:184" default="NO"><author>Pub. Syr.</author> 184</bibl></cit> Rib.</sense></entryFree>
fulmenta: <entryFree id="n18994" type="main" key="fulmenta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulmenta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contr. from fulcimenta, from fulcio</etym> (ante-class.), <sense id="n18994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi> of a building, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 14, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18994.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the heel</hi> of a shoe, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 206, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fulmentum: <entryFree id="n18995" type="main" key="fulmentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulmentum</orth>, i. <gen>n.</gen> <etym>contr. from fulcimentum, from fulcio</etym>, <sense id="n18995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18995.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticus fulmentis Aquitanicis superba,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>columns</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 10</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in Carm.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n18995.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a bedpost</hi>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 15</bibl>.—Prov.: fulmenta lectum scandunt, <hi rend="ital">the child wants to know more than its grandmother;</hi> or, perh., <hi rend="ital">the servant wants to play the master</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 206, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fulminata: <entryFree id="n18996" type="main" key="fulmi^na_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulmĭnāta</orth>, v. fulminatus.</entryFree>
fulminatio: <entryFree id="n18997" type="main" key="fulmi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulmĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fulmino</etym>, <sense id="n18997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a darting of lightning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lightning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulguratio ostendit ignem, fulminatio emittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 12 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
fulminator: <entryFree id="n18998" type="main" key="fulmi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulmĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lightninghurler</hi>, a post-class. designation of Jupiter, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 207</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fulminatrix: <entryFree id="n18999" type="spur" key="fulmi^na_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulmĭnātrix</orth>, false read. for fulminata, v. fulminatus.</entryFree>
fulminatus: <entryFree id="n19000" type="main" key="fulmi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fulmino</etym>, <sense id="n19000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">provided with thunder-bolts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bearing thunder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio XII. fulminata, probably because their shields bore the device of Jupiter brandishing the thunder-bolt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 517</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3174</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 869, 1</bibl>; cf.: <foreign lang="greek">keraunofo/ron strato/pedon</foreign>, Dio. Cass. 55, 23.</sense></entryFree>
fulmineus: <entryFree id="n19001" type="main" key="fulmi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulmĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fulmen</etym>, <sense id="n19001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to lightning</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n19001.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 382</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 524</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 2, 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 618</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fragor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:501" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 501</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19001.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n19001.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sparkling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brilliant</hi>: Mnestheus (i. e. <hi rend="ital">with sparkling arms</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:812" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 812</bibl> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 733</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">fulminea in casside,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 194</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19001.4" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to fulmen, II.) <hi rend="ital">Destructive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murderous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">killing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:167" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os (apri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:232" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 232</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes (apri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rictus lupi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:580" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 580</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 442</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:99" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 200</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fulmino: <entryFree id="n19002" type="main" key="fulmi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulmĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n19002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [id.]. </sense><sense id="n19002.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lighten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hurl lightnings;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>: fulminat, <hi rend="ital">it lightens</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose, for the class. fulgeo):<cb n="FUMI" />  at Boreae de parte trucis cum fulminat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 370</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">minore vi ad fulgurandum opus est quam ad fulminandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec fulminantis magna manus Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulminantem perjurant Jovem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 21</bibl></cit>.—With a homogeneous object: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Aetn.</author> 342</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19002.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar dum magnus ad altum Fulminat Euphraten bello,</quote> <trans><tr>thunders in war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:561" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 561</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fulminat Aeneas armis,</quote> <trans><tr>threatens lightning</tr>, <tr>thunders in arms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 654</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulminat illa oculis,</quote> <trans><tr>hurls lightnings</tr>, <tr>darts fire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 55; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19002.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to strike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">blast with lightning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestis flamma Ingentes quercus, annosas fulminat ornos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Ep. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a deo fulminari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera fulminatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 54, 55, § 145</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19002.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulminatus hac pronuntiatione in lectulum decidi,</quote> <trans><tr>thunderstruck</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 805</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fultor: <entryFree id="n19003" type="main" key="fultor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fultor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>fulcio</etym>, <sense id="n19003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a supporter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prop</hi> (late lat.); trop.: ecclesiae, Venant. Carm. 2, 15, 19.</sense></entryFree>
fultura: <entryFree id="n19004" type="main" key="fultu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fultūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n19004.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundamenta pro fultura et substructione fungentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n19004.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a strengthening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refreshing</hi> (cf. fulcio, I. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">deficient inopem venae te, ni cibus atque Ingens accedit stomacho fultura ruenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (corporis) fulturis animus sustinetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fultus: <entryFree id="n19005" type="main" key="fultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. fulcio.</entryFree>
fulvia: <entryFree id="n19006" type="main" key="Fulvia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fulvia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Fulvius.</entryFree>
fulvaster: <entryFree id="n19007" type="main" key="fulvaster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulvaster</orth>, <itype>tra, trum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fulvus</etym>, <sense id="n19007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">yellowish</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">radix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 109</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fulvius: <entryFree id="n19008" type="main" key="Fulvi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fulvĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n19008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 8, 20</bibl>. So esp., </sense><sense id="n19008.1" n="1" level="3"> M. Fulvius Flaccus, <hi rend="ital">a friend of C. Gracchus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who lost his life with him</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:28:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 28, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 12, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 59</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19008.2" n="2" level="3"> M. Fulvius Nobilior, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19008.3" n="3" level="3"> Q. Fulvius Flaccus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:41:section=106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 41, § 106</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19008.4" n="4" level="3"> Q. Fulvius Nobilior, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 20</bibl>.—Servius Fulvius Flaccus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ib. 21</bibl> and 32.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Fulvia</orth>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of</hi> M. Fulvius Bambalio, <hi rend="ital">and successively the wife of P. Clodius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">C. Curio</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and M. Antony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 12, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19008.5" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n19008.6" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fulvĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Fulvius</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Fulvia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Fulvian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <trans><tr>named after a Fulvius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 57, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stola,</quote> <trans><tr>of Fulvia</tr>, <tr>wife of P. Clodius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:5:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19008.7" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fulvĭaster</orth>, <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an imitator of a Fulvius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 44, 4</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fulvus: <entryFree id="n19009" type="main" key="fulvus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fulvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>v. fulgeo</etym>, <sense id="n19009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deep yellow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reddish yellow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gold-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tawny</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">corpora leonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:902" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 902</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tegmen lupae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 275</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis Lacon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:6:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cassis equinis jubis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 5, 5, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caesaries,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 642</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arena,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 741</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 279</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">subtemen (auri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:80" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 14, 49, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 9, 11, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:88" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 88</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Olympus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:158" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 792</bibl></cit> (but not in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 461</bibl>, where furva is the right reading): <cit><quote lang="la">aquila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:751" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 751</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ales Jovis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntia Jovis, Cic. poët. Leg. 1, 1, 2: virgae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>withering stalks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 191</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fulvum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">reddish-yellow</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 17, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fumariolum: <entryFree id="n19010" type="main" key="fu_ma_ri^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūmārĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>fumarium</etym>, <sense id="n19010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a smoke-hole</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fumariola Vesuvii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fumarium: <entryFree id="n19011" type="main" key="fu_ma_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūmārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>fumus</etym>, <sense id="n19011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a smokechamber for ripening wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:19 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 19 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:36:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 36, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Osee, 13, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fumator: <entryFree id="n19012" type="main" key="fu_ma_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūmātor</orth>, <itype>oris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>fumo</etym>, <sense id="n19012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who ripens wine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 5044</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19012.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a deceiver</hi>, Acron. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fumesco: <entryFree id="n19013" type="main" key="fu_mesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūmesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <sense id="n19013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [fumus], <hi rend="ital">to smoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emit smoke</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 17, 8, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fumeus: <entryFree id="n19014" type="main" key="fu_me^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūmĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of smoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smoky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smoking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina taedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:593" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 593</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acheron,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:595" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 595</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina Massiliae,</quote> <trans><tr>ripened by smoke</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:123" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 123</bibl></cit> (cf. fumarium).</sense></entryFree>
fumicus: <entryFree id="n19015" type="main" key="fu_mi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūmĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">smoky</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">culinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 11</bibl></cit>. <cb n="FUMU" /></sense></entryFree>
fumidus: <entryFree id="n19016" type="main" key="fu_mi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūmĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fumus</etym>, <sense id="n19016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of smoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smoky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smoking.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19016.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 304</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">piceum fert fumida lumen Taeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa caeli (ignibus Aetnae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:644" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 644</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caligo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 42, 42, § 111</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">lux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 25, 22, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 405</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vortex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 43, 43, § 112</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19016.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19016.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Smokecolored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cautes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">topazius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 8, 35, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chrysolithus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 7, 28, § 101</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19016.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Smelling of smoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smoky</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 20, 25, § 127</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fumifer: <entryFree id="n19017" type="main" key="fu_mi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūmĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fumus-fero</etym>, <sense id="n19017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">producing smoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smoking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steaming</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 522</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox (in antro Caci),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aponus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 193</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fumifico: <entryFree id="n19018" type="hapax" key="fu_mi^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūmĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>fumus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n19018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cause smoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to burn incense</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ephesiae Dianae, Arabio odore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fumificus: <entryFree id="n19019" type="main" key="fu_mi^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūmĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">making</hi> or <hi rend="ital">causing smoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smoking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steaming</hi> (poet): faces, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 3, 118: <cit><quote lang="la">mugitus (taurorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 114</bibl></cit> (shortly before: Vulcanum naribus efflant): Epeum fumificum, qui legioni nostrae habet Coctum cibum, <hi rend="ital">making smoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cooking</hi> (acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">busied in smoke</hi>), Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=38" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fumigabundus: <entryFree id="n19020" type="main" key="fu_mi^ga_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūmĭgābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fumigo</etym>, <sense id="n19020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">causing smoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smoking</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sapient. 10, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fumigium: <entryFree id="n19021" type="main" key="fu_mi^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūmĭgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fumigating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fumigation</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fumigo: <entryFree id="n19022" type="main" key="fu_mi^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūmĭgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>fumus-ago</etym>. <sense id="n19022.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to smoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fumigate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 14, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(pulli) pulegii surculis fumigentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumigati parietes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 312, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19022.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to produce smoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to smoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steam.</hi> caelum atrum et fumigantes globi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:1:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fumo: <entryFree id="n19023" type="main" key="fu_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>fumus</etym>, <sense id="n19023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to smoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reek</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fume.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19023.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">acri sulphure montes Oppleti calidis ubi fumant fontibus aucti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:748" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 748</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">late circum loca sulphure fumant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:698" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 698</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recenti fossione terram fumare calentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:9:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est animadversum, fumare aggerem, quem cuniculo hostes succenderant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tepidusque cruor fumabat ad aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fumant altaria donis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:752" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 752</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 18, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumantes pulvere campos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:908" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 908</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos fumantes sudore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 338</bibl></cit>: quod ita domus ipsa fumabat, <hi rend="ital">smoked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reeked</hi> (with banquets), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 10, 24</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 64" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 64</bibl>): et jam summa procul villarum culmina fumant, <hi rend="ital">are smoking</hi> (with fires for the preparation of food), i. e. <hi rend="ital">evening approaches</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 83</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19023.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nullus terror, non obruta jam nunc Semina fumarent belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:654" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 654</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fumosus: <entryFree id="n19024" type="main" key="fu_mo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūmōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of smoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smoking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smoky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smoked</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n19024.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 38, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fax,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">December (because many fires are then made),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:30:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 30, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paries,</quote> <trans><tr>well smoked</tr>, <tr>smoky</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imagines (with age),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">magistri equitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:8" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perna,</quote> <trans><tr>smoke-dried</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 117</bibl></cit>: Falerni, <hi rend="ital">kept in the smokechamber</hi> (fumarium) <hi rend="ital">to ripen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:27" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 27</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cadus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:518" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 518</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19024.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">smelling of smoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smoky</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">defrutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 319</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fumus: <entryFree id="n19025" type="main" key="fu_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. dhū, dhumas, smoke; Zend. dun-man, vapor; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qu/w</foreign>, to rage, sacrifice, <foreign lang="greek">qumo/s, qu=ma, qu/os</foreign>, etc.; Goth. dauns, odor; Engl. dust; cf.: fūnus, fuligo</etym>, <sense id="n19025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">smoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fume</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lignis si flamma latet fumusque cinisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:871" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 871</bibl></cit>; cf. 1, 891; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 56: ibi hominem ingenuum fumo excruciatum, semivivum reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:17:section=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 17, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra, ut fumo atque ignibus significabatur, amplius milibus pass. VIII. in latitudinem patebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2</bibl></cit>. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum fumi incendiorum procul videbantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 48</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">significatione per castella fumo facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:65:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 65, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ater ad sidera fumus erigitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pernas in fumo suspendito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 162, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumo inveteratum vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1</bibl></cit>. 22, § 40; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:19 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 19 sq.</bibl>; v. fumarium; hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fumi Massiliae,</quote> <trans><tr>Marseilles wine mellowed in the smoke</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:118" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 118</bibl></cit>: in illo ganearum tuarum<pb n="792" /> <cb n="FUND" />  nidore atque fumo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 6, 13</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">intervenerant quidam amici, propter quos major fumus fieret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 64" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 64</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non fumum ex fulgore, sed ex fumo dare lucem Cogitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 143</bibl></cit>.—In double sense: <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Oculi dolent. <hi rend="ital">Ad.</hi> Quor? <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Quia fumus molestus est, <hi rend="ital">smoke</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">foolish talk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 10</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n19025.1" n="b" level="4"> Prov. </sense><sense id="n19025.2" n="(a)" level="5"> Semper flamma fumo est proxima: <cit><quote lang="la">Fumo comburi nihil potest, flamma potest,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the slightest approach to wrong-doing leads to vice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19025.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Tendere de fumo, ut proverbium loquitur vetus, ad flammam, <hi rend="ital">to jump out of the frying-pan into the fire</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 12</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de fumo, ut aiunt, in flammam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 28, 1, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19025.4" n="(g)" level="5"> Fumum or fumos vendere, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to make empty promises</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:5:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 313, 31</bibl>.—For which also: <cit><quote lang="la">per fumum or fumis vendere aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Anton. 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19025.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, like our word <hi rend="ital">smoke</hi>, as a figure of <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi>: ubi omne Verterat in fumum et cinerem, <hi rend="ital">had reduced to smoke and ashes</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">had consumed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squandered</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
funale: <entryFree id="n19026" type="main" key="fu_na_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūnāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. funalis, II.</entryFree>
funalis: <entryFree id="n19027" type="main" key="fu_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>funis</etym>, <sense id="n19027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attached to a rope</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cord</hi>: equus, <hi rend="ital">an extra horse yoked to a chariot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but attached to it at the side of the others by a rope</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trace-horse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:462" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 462</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epit. 35, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 183" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 183</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cereus,</quote> <trans><tr>a wax-torch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:6:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also candela,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 11, 143</bibl></cit>; cf. II. B.—</sense><sense id="n19027.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fūnāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n19027.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A cord</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thong of a sling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">funda media duo funalia imparia habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:65:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 65, 10</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n19027.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A wax-torch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">taper</hi> (cf.: taeda, fax, candela): funale <foreign lang="greek">lampa/dion</foreign>, funalia <foreign lang="greek">daloi/</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 727</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 143</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Duilius delectabatur crebro funali et tibicine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem flammis funalia vincunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 727</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 26, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:667" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 667</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19027.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a chandelier</hi>, i. q. candelabrum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 247</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 10, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
funambulus: <entryFree id="n19028" type="main" key="fu_nambu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūnambŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>funis-ambulo</etym>, <sense id="n19028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rope-dancer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:prol. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. prol. 4</bibl>; prol. alt. 26; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 6</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu funambule pudicitiae et castitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Pudic. 10</bibl></cit>. —Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">fūnĭambŭlus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 39:9" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 39, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
funarius: <entryFree id="n19029" type="main" key="fu_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>funis</etym>, <sense id="n19029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a rope</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">equus, i. q. funalis equus,</quote> <trans><tr>an extra horse</tr>, <tr>trace-horse</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 35, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19029.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fūnā-rĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a surname of</hi> Gratianus, <hi rend="ital">father of the emperor</hi> Valentinianus (so called from his bodily strength, because five men could not drag a rope out of his hands), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 45" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 7, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
functio: <entryFree id="n19030" type="main" key="functi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">functĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fungor</etym>, <sense id="n19030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a performing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">executing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discharging; a performance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">execution.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19030.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (Ciceron., but very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">labor est functio quaedam vel animi vel corporis gravioris operis et muneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:15:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 15, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut iis jucundior esset muneris illius functio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:6:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 6, § 15</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n19030.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">functionem recipere per solutionem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>perform the part</tr>, <tr>supply the place of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:1:2:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 1, 2, § 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19030.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic. (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n19030.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Payment of taxes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 54, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 22, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19030.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An ending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi> (of life), <hi rend="ital">death</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inevitabilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortalium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 104</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
functus: <entryFree id="n19031" type="main" key="functus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">functus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from fungor.</entryFree>
funda: <entryFree id="n19032" type="main" key="funda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">funda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. spandē, itch; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sfada/zw</foreign>, to move convulsively; <foreign lang="greek">sfodro/s, sfedano/s</foreign>, impassioned; <foreign lang="greek">sfendo/nh</foreign>; cf. 3. fūsus</etym>, <sense id="n19032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sling.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19032.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">funda dicta eo, quod ex ea fundantur lapides, id est emittantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde fundis, sagittis, tormentis hostes propelli ac summoveri jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 25, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 35</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 5, 43, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:29:4 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 29, 4 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 201</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:32 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 32 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 16</bibl>; Cic. poët. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 309</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:586" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 586</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:517 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 517 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n19032.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19032.3" n="A" level="2"> That which is thrown with a sling, <hi rend="ital">the sling-stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">missile</hi>,, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:152" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 152</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n19032.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A casting-net</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drag-net</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 141</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19032.5" n="C" level="2"> (From the similarity to the hollow of a sling in which the stone lay, like <foreign lang="greek">sfendo/nh</foreign>.) <hi rend="ital">The hollow of a ring in which a jewel is set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the bezel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 8, 37, § 116</bibl> <cb n="FUND" /> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:9:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 9, 38</bibl>, called pala anuli).—</sense><sense id="n19032.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A money-bag</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purse</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
fundalis: <entryFree id="n19033" type="main" key="funda_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fundālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>funda</etym>, <sense id="n19033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a sling</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">stridor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 293</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fundamen: <entryFree id="n19034" type="main" key="funda_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fundāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>2. fundo</etym>, <sense id="n19034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a foundation</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for the class. fundamentum; mostly in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">ponere fundamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Siculae terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 361</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:433" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 433</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:835" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 835</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundamine magno res Romana valet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:808" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 808</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Gal. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fundamentum: <entryFree id="n19035" type="main" key="funda_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fundāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a foundation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ground-work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">basis</hi> (class.; mostly in <number>plur.</number>; cf. basis). </sense><sense id="n19035.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19035.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quin cum fundamento (aedes) Perierint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">substruere fundamentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19035.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">operum fastigia spectantur, latent fundamenta, Quint. prooem. § 4: agere fundamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 27, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximorum operum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Marc. 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima urbi jacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12, 4</bibl></cit> (cf. under II. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign> the passage from <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 2, 4</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">novae domus jacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alta theatri locare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altae Carthaginis locare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 266</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 14, 21, § 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fodere delubro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 2, 4, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subdere per solidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis quatit Neptunus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 611</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa turris, quibus fundamenta continebantur, convellunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villa a fundamentis inchoata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Albam a fundamentis proruere,</quote> <trans><tr>utterly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 13, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs a fundamentis diruta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:63:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 63, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:67:9" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 67, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19035.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the bottom</hi>, = fundus: <cit><quote lang="la">qui a fundamento mihi usque movisti mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib. 2:6:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19035.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (syn.: sedes, initium). </sense><sense id="n19035.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meo judicio pietas fundamentum est omnium virtutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 12, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fundamentum justitiae est fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narratio est quaedam quasi sedes et fundamentum constituendae fidei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 9, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:37:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 37, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">initium ac fundamentum defensionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum criminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod fundamentum hujus quaestionis est, id videtis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:17:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 17, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplina nixa fundamento veritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundamentum et causa imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:41" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput et fundamentum intellegitur totius testamenti heredis institutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:229" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 229</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19035.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Piur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illic radices, illic fundamenta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus initiis ac fundamentis hae tantae summis in rebus laudes excitatae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 72</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatus tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus, quae fundamentis adolescentiae constituta est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 18, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad evertenda fundamenta rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacere pacis fundamenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with jacio: rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 12, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 10, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">defensionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutis suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non praeterit me quam magnarum rerum fundamenta ponam senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3 praef.</bibl></cit> 1: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 13:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 13, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impudentiae, Quint 12, 6, 2: futuri oratoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 1:4:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; for which also with the <case>dat.</case> (cf. supra I. the passage from <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12, 4</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">cui causae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verecundiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 4, 4</bibl></cit> Mos.: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 18, 20, § 78</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
